title: couple who married after meeting
story: Couple who married after meeting on Tinder dont think about  year age gapJulia Sellge Monteiro, , and Eileen de Freest, , say that they are at a stage in their relationship where they dont even think about the age gap anymoreJulia Zelg and Eileen De Freest posing for a photo together in London Image:   Barcroft MediaByEmma Magnus:,  Nov | commentsA lesbian couple aged  years apart said they do not think about the age gap of almost four decades after getting married in .Julia Sellge Monteiro, a -year-old singer-songwriter and YouTuber, married Eileen de Freest, , in  and made their wedding available to watch on Juliaaposs YouTube channel. The couple live together in Cha, west London, reports MyLondon.Originally from Sao Paulo, Julianow has more than , followers, and her videos have been watched by over  million people. Sheaposs prolic, posting new content twice a week, alongside working as a singer-songwriter. Eileen, hailing from New Jersey, is retired.  She has a YouTube channel of her own, but, given the demand, the couple decided to start creating more content together on Juliaaposs account. In their videos, they rate each otheraposs outfits, film their travels together and, above all, share the intimacies of their relationship with their followers, from the big momentsto the small . The videos are tagged: Lesbian Age Gap Couple. I think weaposre just lucky that weaposve had this unique opportunity to fall in love and we havenapost been limited by our ages, says Eileen. What comes across [in our videos] is not that weaposre dferent in age, but that weaposre two people who really love each other. They add that they are at a stage in their relationship where they donapost even think about the age gap anymore. Weaposre very used to it, and we donapost even think about it, says Julia.  But there are a few things that are dferent - I mean, I wonapost take Eileen hiking with me. And she knows dferent music and things from a dferent time. Eileen agrees, saying: Weaposre lucky to have met somewhere in this magic middle. She concedes that there are definitely dferences, like having dferent cultural frames of reference. Eileen may have the benefit of experience, but she says their relationship has challenged her views on gender and pushed her feminism to become more intersectional. Iaposve learned from [Julia] things that werenapost part of my experience, she explains. Their friends, they say, are a mix of ages - some closer to Eileen, some to Julia, and plenty in between. They werenapost surprised when Eileen and Julia introduced their new partners. As Eileen puts it: My friends are open-minded. Nobody was too bothered about it...Iaposve never had any kickback, have you  No, Julia responds. My friends have always been very supportive, but Iaposve been with an older woman before, so they were kind of used to it anyway.  She adds: Weaposve never had any problems in public... people stare a little bit, but it could be our hair. It was Eileen who made the first move on Tinder, swiping right and initiating an intense message conversation, before finally asking Julia out on a date. Julia says: We were supposed to go out for dinner, but Eileen was having a problem with her knee, so she askedI wanted to come over to her place. Instead, they ordered pizza and drank wine. Julia says: We got on straight away. We just clicked...Eileen made me feel so comfortable. Eileen may have made the first move, but it was Julia who popped the big question, pulling Eileen up on stage with her at a gig in London to get down on one knee YouTube too.Love is love, Julia says simply, summarising what she wants viewers to take from her channel. As long as youaposre not harming anyone and youaposre just doing your best, you shouldnapost be judged for that. Everybody should focus on being themselves and being kind to one another, instead of judging. title: divisive e10 bio fuel could
story: Divisive E bio fuel could have a negative impact on every driver using itThe new climate friendly E fuel could lead to worse problems for drivers because it is less energy dense, meaning motorists will have to use more to cover similar distancesThe fuel is apparently less energy dense means that motorists may have to top up more often Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByMya BollanTrainee Trends WriterLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov | commentsFuel that is more environmentally friendly may actually pose more issues for some drivers, experts have warned. The new climate friendly E fuel could lead to worse problems for drivers because it is less energy dense, meaning motorists will have to use more to cover similar distances. The fuel, that was introduced in September, has won admirers because it contains a higher percentage of renewable fuel - bioethanol. This means it is better for the environment due to the lower levels of carbon emissions. But motoring YouTube channel Number  has warned that E may have far worse problems that could affect all petrol car users. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here The issue, they say, with it being less energy dense means that motorists may have to top up more often, leading to additional costs. In the video, the presenter says: “I need to talk to you about something pretty shocking Iaposve just found out about E fuel. “And it has absolutely nothing to do with the fact it might damage old classics. “No, there is a far worse problem with using E. “It affects every single car on the road which uses petrol whether it is one of the oldest or the very newest car that’s out.” He added: “E causes an increase in fuel consumption for any car thataposs using it. Ethanol is less energy-dense than unleaded fuel.  “So that means that because it has this lower energy density you have to use more and therefore your fuel consumption in your car will go up. “You’re not going to lose any power because your caraposs computer will alter the air-fuel balance to make up for that loss of energy density. “But your fuel consumption will go up. I really couldnapost believe it.” The Department for Transportaposs Introducing E petrol study confirmed drivers would experience lower fuel economy under the new E grade. They confirmed fuel economy may drop by up to two per cent using the new compound. But they said this was ultimately down to the “driving style” of motorists.  The revelation came after concerns were raised by a quarter of private iniduals in relation to fuel economy in the consultation. Drivers questioned about the changes warned this could “mitigate emissions benefits” and could have a “cost impact”. The DfT said: “We have considered the impact on fuel economy and decreasing MPG, which is due to the lower energy density of ethanol compared with fossil petrol when developing our proposals. “Analysis based on average caloric values of the two products suggests fuel economy could reduce by between one and two per cent. “However, the impact will y based on driving style and refinements in fuel blending by suppliers.” According to the RAC, the US Energy Information Administrationclaims the energy content of ethanol is around  per cent lower than unleaded. This means vehicle fuel economy may reduce by around three per cent when using the new fuel. A number of drivers have reported suffering from fuel efficiency problems when using the new fuel. Some Express readers have even complained of receiving up to mpg less since the changes. Comment MORE ON Department for TransportCars" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: how much costs buy week
story: How much it costs to buy a week of frozen food at dferent UK supermarketsBuying the same five items in Tesco, Morrisons, Asda, Sainsburys, Iceland and Farmfoods brought up some interesting results at stores in Manchester this weekThis week the cost of five items from superstores ied dramatically Image: Getty ImagesByEmma Gill:,  Nov | commentsFor many busy families, frozen food can be a massive help. Thereaposs often little chance to cook from scratch, especially during the week. Itaposs also a good way of limiting our food waste at a time when weaposre all trying to do our bit for the environment and keep costs down. But itaposs surprising just how much the prices of products can dfer from store to store.To find out how supermarkets compare, the Manchester Evening News visited six stores to buy the same five items.These were Birds Eye potato waffles, Richmond skinless sausages, Birds Eye chicken dippers, Birds Eye omega  fish fingers and Mars ice creams. While some had offers on that would have reduced prices by buying in bulk, we stuck to one of each item for a fairer comparison. We also didnapost take advantage of Tescoaposs Clubcard prices, which would have reduced the bill there.  The pack sizes were mostly exactly the same - with just a larger pack of ice creams in Farmfoods, which weaposve accounted for, and a smaller pack of fish fingers in Iceland, which was balanced out by the larger pack of sausages. We were shocked to discover that overall Tesco came in at the most expensive, at £. for all five items, while Sainsburyaposs - where prices used to be at the higher end - was the cheapest at £.. Thataposs almost a % dference and was helped by the current offer on Mars ice creams, reduced from £ to £. While easier said than doneyour budget is tight or you have little freezer space at home, what our shopping trip did prove was just how much consumers can save by buying in bulk.  At Iceland it was much cheaper to buy two of many of its products - two packs of the skinless sausages for £, saving £. and two packs of Mars ice creams for £, saving £. The same ice cream offer was available at Asda and Morrisons too. And at Iceland a current offer on the -pack of chicken nuggets meant we also got a free pack of  Fab ice lollies worth £. Farmfoods had similar bulk offers, with two boxes of the waffles for £ and the larger box of ice creams bringing the price down too. Had we made use of the Clubcard at Tesco, we could have got the fish fingers for £ instead of £, bringing the overall bill to £. and making it the joint second cheapest along with Asda. title: joy mum inspirational boy 6
story: Joy for Bradley Lowerys mum as she celebrates birth of baby girlGemma and Carl Lowery welcomed Gracie-Mae four years after their son Bradley died of cancer, aged six - they have already said he is the  angel to his little brother or sisterGemma and Carl Lowery welcomed Gracie-Mae at .am on November ByNicole GoodwinAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsThe mum of an inspirational boy who died of cancer has given birth to a baby girl. Gemma and Carl Lowery welcomed Gracie-Mae at .am on November .She was born via emergency cesarian at Sunderland Royal hospital and is believed to be doing well , ChronicleLive reports.In a Facebook post, Gemma said she didnapost have the best of labour, but their daughter was now doing amazing. When the parents first announced the pregnancy, they also paid tribute to their son Bradley who died in July  saying he is theangel to his little brother or sister. Sunderland fan Bradley was diagnosed with neuroblastoma, a type of cancer found mainly in babies and young children, at the age of just  months. The six-year-old captured the hearts of the nation and he struck up a friendship with then Black Cats striker Jermain Defoe and was a mascot for Sunderland.Bradley was even named joint winner of the December  BBC Goal of the Month for a penalty he took against Cha. The coupleaposs post read: Hi everyone just an update to welcome our beautul little princess to the world. Gracie-Mae was born :am on th November weighing lb. I didnapost have the best of labour but Iaposll not bore you all with the details. I had to have an emergency C section as her heart rate dropped and they needed her out. She is now doing amazing and we are on our way home. I want to say a huge shout out to all the staff on the maternity unit at Sunderland Royal hospital. Every single one of them from start of care when I fell pregnant to leaving tonight have been incredible. Myself and Carl are going to now enjoy some family time with our beautul princess.  I know everyone will be eager to see her, and I’ll be sharing some pictures soon, but we want all the family to meet her first. Thank you all for your support. In September, two streets were named in honour of Bradley. Bradley Lowery Way leading to Sunshine Place is part of the new Hardwicke Place development in Blackhall Colliery, County Durham, close to his familyaposs home. Sunshine was the nickname Gemma and husband Carl gave Bradley, due to his sunny disposition despite the pain and discomfort he was suffering throughout his illness. title: madeleine mccann suspect admitted ex
story: Madeleine McCann suspect admitted to ex he was close to where missing girl was abductedChristian Brueckner fell silent when friends spoke about the vanished toddler, Nakscije Mtari claims - but later admitted being nearby at the time she was takenPrime suspect Christian Brueckner with former girlfriend Nakscije Mtari Image: Gkalbln   MEGAByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Nov A former girlfriend of the prime suspect in the Madeleine McCann case says he was close to the scene where she disappeared from. Christian Brueckner fell silent when friends spoke about the vanished toddler, Nakscije Mtari claims - but later admitted being nearby at the time. Ms Mtari also said that the convicted paedophile, now , hit her when she discovered child pornography showing young blonde girls being abused on his phone.In an interview with the Mail on Sunday, she said that Madeleineaposs disappearance had been raised by pals in  at a party in their home in Braunschweig, Germany.But Brueckner made no answer when it was discussed, Ms Mtari said.  When she asked him about it later, she said he told her: “I know about Maddie, I was near the hotel at the time. I was living in the area at the time. I am not going to say anything more. The three-year-old vanished from a holiday apartment in Praia da Luz, Portugal, in May . Ms Mtari - who has told German police about the conversation - said she was terried of her former partner, who she described as controlling. The relationship, which began when she was , came to an end when he launched a brutal attack on her when she discovered child pornography on his phone and laptop. She said: I asked him about the videos and pictures and that’s when he punched me. Ms Mtari, now , said she fell down the stairs and was unconscious for around  minutes after the attack, which she and her mother reported to the police. Police discovered nearly  photos of children being abused and  videos, including images showing Brueckner abusing the daughter of a previous girlfriend. In  he was jailed for  months for the assault. German authorities identied Christian Brueckner as a prime suspect in Maddieaposs case last year and said they had concrete evidence the missing girl was dead. Investigators are now said to be  per cent convinced the convicted sex offender is the man responsible. But the -year-old has taunted German prosecutor Hans Christian Wolters, who claims to have enough evidence to charge the rapist, saying he is bluffing. Sources close to Brueckner told The Sun Online : B and his legal team remain sure Wolters and his investigators don’t have a shred of evidence to convict him on or charge him over.Their position has always been clear:there is evidence, show it. But the police never have. That’s why they are convinced these comments are a bluff designed to get B to crack behind bars and confess to someone. That will never happen. B believes Wolters is simply a celebrity cop looking to make headlines.” Brueckner is currently serving a seven-year sentence for raping an American tourist in Portugal in  and the prosecution team are taking time to gather as much evidence as possible before bringing allegations to court.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Madeleine MccannCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: meet community groups government hopes
story: Meet the community groups Government hopes can tackle countrys health and wellbeing crisisUp and down the country community groups are aiming to tackle the country’s health crisis in the wake of the pandemic with singing, poetry, gardening and paracise exercise classesMost people with conditions like pulmonary fibrosis had to find support groups themselves by in  the NHS committed to hiring , special coordinators helping doctors prescribe activities Image: Getty Images MaskotByElizabeth Archer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsAs Christine Cole belted out the lyrics to her favourite song, a huge smile spread across her face. She was finally back at her weekly choir meeting, after months of online sessions only during lockdown. But this isn’t any choir – it’s a special singing group, Shared Harmonies, for people with respiratory problems. For Christine, who has pulmonary fibrosis, it’s a leline. “It’s brilliant,” says Christine, , a retired secretary who lives in Drighlington, West Yorks, with her husband David, . “You meet new people. You make friends and are able to talk to people who really understand your problems.” Until now, most people with conditions like pulmonary fibrosis had to find such support groups themselves by searching online or contacting charities. But in , the NHS committed to hiring , special coordinators by March  – helping doctors prescribe activities like gardening groups, community choirs and fitness classes.Now, the Government hopes community groups can help tackle the country’s health and wellbeing crisis in the wake of the pandemic. Emma Baylin, a former NHS volunteer coordinator, welcomes the changes. “It’s positive the NHS sees the value in social prescribing. It can help with early intervention and prevention for a host of wellbeing and health issues,” she says. “I’ve seen first-hand people who have reduced their dependence on NHS services through accessing community groups.”  Nicola Harker, a le coach and former NHS GP , agrees. While working as a GP, she once took the unusual decision to prescribe poetry writing to a patient who had suffered a stroke and was struggling to express himself verbally. “It’s hugely valuable. This particular patient was very frustrated but traditional medication wouldn’t have been able to help. It almost brought me to tears to see how his le changed because he had a new vocation and he solved his communication dficulties,” she says. “While we have to be realistic that social prescribing can’t patch over the funding gaps in the NHS, it can certainly help. “I’d like to see people on the waiting list for mental health services being connected with community projects in the meantime, or people going through cancer treatment finding groups which allow them to express their experiences.” Christine was diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis in  after a persistent cough and breathlessness. At the time, she was given from three to five years to live. “It was devastating, but doctors have since found a cause for my condition and I’m still here  years later,” she says. She found out about Shared Harmonies online, and discovered a class a few miles away in Leeds. “We start by doing relaxation exercises, before deep breathing and stretching. Then we sing two or three simple, short songs with harmonies. “Sometimes we get things wrong and have a few laughs. I’ve made great friends over the years and couldn’t wait to get back to meeting in person after lockdown.” While Christine and her husband were lucky enough to find lots of local support groups online, she agrees more people would find groupsdoctors signposted patients to them. “I don’t know what I’d do without them,” she says. “I have friends locally who I can talk to but it’s not the same as speaking to someone who really understands what you’re going through.”  Christine goes for regular breathing tests and says singing every week has improved her lungby seven per cent. But it’s the emotional support she values most. “It’s so comforting knowing there are groups like this out there, and I think it’s great the NHS is going to start prescribing community classes more.” Avril Clerkson, who teaches fitness classes for people with limited mobility, is also thrilled about the NHS proposals. “People often think they won’t be able to exercise after surgery or being diagnosed with an illness, but we offer a class anybody can do regardless of mobility,” says Avril, , who lives in Addiewell, West Lothian, with husband Steven, . She found out about Paracise exercise classes after being diagnosed with breast cancer during a routine mammogram. She had a lumpectomy and some of her lymph nodes were removed, meaning she had limited movement in her left side and suffered from lymphedema, a fluid build-up in the body. “The diagnosis was a horrible shock and I’d always been very active so it was great to find a class I could still do after my surgery.”  Since starting the classes, she has regained full movement in her left side and the swelling in her left arm is greatly reduced. Now she teaches Paracise classes and has seen the benefits for others too.In lockdown, she could be found bouncing around in her kitchen teaching classes on Facebook.“A lot of people were saying they lived alone and were missing the company Paracise brings,” she says. “So I kept the groups going online and it was a godsend for a lot of people.”The Scottish health service already refers people to her classes for a range of health conditions, including arthritis, fibromyalgia and stroke. And she is glad social prescribing is becoming more widespread.“Classes like this can help prevent people having falls at home, help faster recovery from surgery, and can prevent some people needing mental health services, which eases the NHS burden.” For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.Aishah Iqbal has psoriasis and says community groups helped her cope with the condition in lockdown. “I’ve had it for  years. It started during my GCSEs from stress and has impacted me at dferent points in my le,” says Aishah, , a paediatric doctor from Leicester. “It gets really itchy and has an impact on my ability to concentrate in the day and I don’t get much sleep at night so it’s a horrible cycle and hits my confidence.” During lockdown she suffered a particularly bad flare-up and turned to a community support group she found through Facebook. “When I wasn’t really getting much social interaction, I found it harder to fight the sad feelings brought on by my condition. “But having people around me who were going through something similar made me realise I wasn’t alone.” Aishah believes social prescribing can be a leline. “Stress and anxiety can make long-term health conditions much worse, so while medication can help, emotional support is important too. While the NHS is great, there are limits to what it can provide, so putting people in touch with community groups is a great idea.” ■For more information go to sharedharmonies or paracise Comment MORE ON NHSHospitalsMental healthPrescriptionsFitnessSunday MirrorCoronavirusFitness And Health" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: miracle baby never know tragic
story: Exclusive: Miracle baby will never know tragic mum who died after refusing Covid jab while pregnantThe distraught family of Saiqa Parveen from Birmingham have urged pregnant women for Gods sake - get the vaccine after she caught Covid and died in intensive care while carrying her fth childSaiqa Parveen, , died in intensive care after catching the virus while carrying her fth childByJohn Siddle:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov This beautul baby girl slumbers peacefully – unaware she will never meet her Covid victim mum. Saiqa Parveen, , who refused the jab while pregnant, died after Dua was saved by a ­caesarean. Today Saiqa’s brother begs mums-to-be: “For God’s sake, get the vaccine.The heartbroken family of the unvaccinated mum who died from Covid without getting to meet her newborn daughter have begged all pregnant women to get jabbed, Birmingham Live reports.Saiqa died in intensive care after catching the virus while carrying her fth child and before she went into hospital. Last night her distraught family told the Birmingham Live of their pain as they implored other expectant mums to get vaccinated. Releasing a picture of Saiqa fighting for le in hospital – and the beautul baby she never got to hold – brother Qayoum Mughal, , urged: “For God’s sake, get the vaccine.”Saiqa, from Birmingham, was eight months into her pregnancy when she fell ill in mid-September. She was offered a Covid shot in summer but insisted she wanted to wait until her baby was born. As her condition worsened, Saiqa was placed in intensive care and underwent an emergency caesarean section at full term on September . She died this week – leaving behind her husband Majid Ghafur, , and daughters Noor, , Imaan, , Hibbah, eight, and Ayesha, six – and without ever meeting newborn Dua Maryam. Qayoum revealed how Saiqa’s daughters made a heartbreaking final online FaceTime call just an hour before their mum died on November . He told the Sunday Mercury: “They said, ‘Get up mummy, we are waiting, we are missing you, we love you, why are you leaving us behind  Just get up’. They were praying and in tears.” One in five of the most critically ill Covid patients are unvaccinated pregnant women, NHS figures show.Since July, % of patients on special lung-bypass machines were expectant mums who had not had their first jab. Qayoum, a dad of four, said: “I strongly ask all people please get their vaccination, otherwise you will have a bad situation like we are facing. “Get the vaccine and avoid this sort of tragedy. The family is completely broken. There is such a big sadness.” Saiqa had no underlying health conditions and her pregnancy had been routine until she tested positive for Covid on September . Two days later she developed breathing problems and was taken by ambulance to Birmingham’s Heartlands Hospital. She was discharged six days later only to be admitted to Good Hope Hospital on September  with breathing dficulties. Qayoum said: “She was on oxygen and on September  she called my we at pm and said she had signed documents saying thather condition worsened, the doctors could operate to take the baby out. “My we said she sounded very tired and only spoke for a few minutes. That was the last conversation with any of us. “The next morning her husband phoned us and told us that she was on a ventilator and they were preparing to operate. At pm, the doctor called her husband and told him they had delivered a baby girl. “We did not see her because she was on a ventilator in intensive care. She never saw her daughter.”By now Saiqa was also battling le threatening sepsis, a hole in both her lungs, as well as pneumonia and other infections.Qayoum said: “They allowed her husband to see her on October  and the doctor said she was very ill. “The doctor was telling him to talk to her. She was sedated but could hear. “He was talking to her, telling her that her eldest daughter is asking you to get up and ‘where is her birthday gt’ and she is missing mum. As soon as he said this, there was one long tear coming from her eye. That was the first and last reaction we had from her on the ventilator.”  Saiqa died just before pm on Monday. Her death certicate records respiratory failure and Covid- pneumonitis as the cause. Qayoum, who has had Covid himself, said: “Her daughters ask, ‘When’s mummy coming back ’ Saiqa was the most caring person, she couldn’t live without her family. She was a lady of principle. “She cared for everybody and her mother is still alive. She was very hard working and a helpful lady.” He added: “Her husband is crying but he’s got to be strong for his daughters.” The Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation says all pregnant women should be offered a Covid jab after studies proved it is safe. Previously it was offered only to pregnant women in frontline health and care or to the extremely clinically vulnerable. More than , mums-to-be have had a first dose and around , a second. Data from over , Covid vaccinations in pregnancy in England and Scotland, and a further , in the US, show there has been no subsequent harm to the foetus or baby. England’s chief midwery officer Jacqueline Dunkley-Bent said: “The Covid- jab can keep you, your baby and your loved ones out of hospital.”For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON NHSHospitalsPregnancyGiving birthNewborn babyCoronavirusSunday PeopleCoronavirus vaccine" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news morgue-monster-david-fullers-horried-"David Fuller is arrested for historic murders of two womenByPatrick HillDan WarburtonReporter for the Sunday Mirror and People:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A horried nurse has told of her two-year affair with morgue monster David Fuller, not knowing he had killed two women.The warped hospital electrician wooed the unsuspecting woman with cocktails and concert tickets. Then he dumped her for another nurse – all behind the back of his trusting we. Fuller, , would go on to abuse scores of bodies in two hospital mortuaries. But his mistress only learned of his grotesque offences when he faced court last week. She told the Sunday Mirror today: “To think I’m associated with someone who did something so terrible is awful. I’m very lucky he didn’t kill me.”  As MPs called for an inquiry into Fuller’s hospital access, the woman, whose identity we are protecting, also revealed:She lived in a studio flat just around the corner from his two victims in the Bedsit Murders. Fuller charmed her and seemed the “perfect gentleman”. They met at a hospital social club, he drank Archers and lemonade and once took her to a Beverley Craven pop concert. Fuller always appeared to be ice cool and “would never get angry”.The woman believed Fuller to be an “ordinary, quiet man” – yet he was an arrogant lothario who had affairs with at least two female colleagues during three marriages. She started dating Fuller in  when he was with second we. Three years earlier he had sexually assaulted and killed Wendy Knell, , and Caroline Pierce, , in Tunbridge Wells, Kent.  The woman, now happily married, said: “I was quite aware of the Bedsit Murders and I was very nervous about them. The murders were in my mind and a lot of young women’s minds. “Little did I know I was actually dating the person responsible. In the back of my mind I do still think, ‘Why was I spared ’ “I was in the right criteria in that I lived in the roads near where the girls worked, I had a bedsit and I was in my s.”  Fuller admitted his guilt last week, four days into a murder trial. It was then revealed in court that he had defiled up to  bodies in hospital morgues. His female victims ranged in age from nine to . The revelations have shaken Fuller’s ex to the core. She told the Sunday Mirror: “He was a perfect gentleman with me. I didn’t see a bad side to him at all.  “There was nothing to lead me to believe he’s the person we’ve now found him out to be now. “He never showed any perversion in bed. He was totally ordinary and normal. There was nothing at all. I still can’t believe that he could be capable and part of me still doesn’t want to believe it, but equally I want him to pay for what he’s done. “I didn’t know anything about the mortuary offences until it came out in court. I was really shocked. The police said to me, ‘Be prepared for a nasty shock’, but I wasn’t expecting anything as horric as this. I just thought it was going to be that there were other women like me, or multiple women that he was dating all at the same time. It’s been a traumatic time.”  She went on: “I was  when I began seeing him and I was with him for just over two years. “I was a district nurse and some of us used to go up to the canteen in Kent and Sussex Hospital . I was at a loose end and trying to make new friends, so I started going to the social club. I remember thinking he was quite odd for a man because he drank Archers and lemonade. “He wasn’t a beer man. He was quite a quiet man, but he was quite friendly. He just seemed like a perfectly ordinary person.”  She remembers Fuller being in a cycling club and doing the -mile London to Brighton ride. One of the club routes went directly past the dyke where he dumped murdered Caroline. Of their dates, she said: “The first outing was to the Folkestone Air Show. We once went to a Beverley Craven concert in London and he would visit me at my flat, but most of it was at the social club at the hospital. “He wasn’t the type of bloke to take me out for dinner or offer to take me anywhere particularly, but he was always pleasant and friendly. He would never get angry. It was hard to know what was going on in his head.  “He was an electrician at Kent  Sussex Hospital at the time. Sometimes when he was on call, rather than stay in his house at Broomhill Bank School, he’d stay in the nurses’ home. “I knew he was unhappy with his we. But our relationship ended because he didn’t want what I wanted and he didn’t want to be with me any more. I had to accept that he didn’t want me and he wanted someone . “I remember him saying to me that he had met another staff nurse and he was going to start seeing her.”  The woman called police last December after news of Fuller’s arrest. She explained: “When I saw his name I thought, ‘Well, Fuller is a common surname’. I looked at my phone hours later and there was a photo of him. I recognised him from the fact his eye was turning in. I was really shocked.” Fuller’s arrest came after a DNA breakthrough. A search of his home uncovered hard drives revealing prolic sexual offending of a kind no British court has seen before. Between  and , he had filmed and photographed himself sexually abusing the bodies of dozens of women and girls at the Kent and Sussex Hospital and nearby Tunbridge Wells Hospital. Fuller admitted two counts of murder at Maidstone Crown Court. He previously admitted  sexual offences, including  counts relating to  identiable mortuary victims. MPs have called for a public inquiry. And the daughter of one victim said: “It kills me to think of David Fuller’s hands on Mum in the mortuary.” Meanwhile, his shaken ex is having counselling. She added: “What he did is up there with the Moors Murderers, the Wests and Shipman. If I could eradicate it all, I would. I keep thinking, ‘Why was I so naive and stupid to get involved with someone like him ’” aposFailure to learn lessons of Savileapos - Comment, by Mark Williams-Thomas, the ex-cop who exposed Jimmy Savile The dead deserve as much dignity as the living, but David Fuller denied victims any respect whatsoever. He got away with murder for  years. Evading capture, he convinced himself he was untouchable. And, like all sex offenders, he then sought out vulnerable victims – dead women and children – to fulfil his warped sexual desires. But it is only by luck and the arrogance of Fuller that the police uncovered sexual offending as far back as  at two Kent hospitals because he kept “trophies” of his attacks and records of his abuse. In , I exposed Jimmy Savile – the DJ and TV star who sexually assaulted patients for decades across the NHS. It led to  hospitals undertaking urgent reviews.But it is clear now that lessons were not learned and, yet again, the most vulnerable in our society have been failed. In  Fuller had a criminal records check which revealed he had hidden a string of burglary convictions. Yet he stayed in post. Fuller should have been sacked immediately. So why wasn’t he  Crimes of necrophilia are extremely rare and carry a maximum jail term of just two years. Post-Savile, a review highlighted the need to reduce access to mortuaries, yet this was clearly not the case at two Kent hospitals.  When Fuller murdered Wendy and Caroline he took trophies – something he repeated will all his future victims. That brings with it considerable risk because it’s a forensic link to the victim and compelling evidence. So why take such a risk  I have no doubt Fuller kept trophies so he could relive his attacks and watch footage again, enabling him to get perverse sexual gratication. I’ve no doubt Fuller has abused many more women and young people. His offending will be far wider than hospital mortuaries. I would go much further, given that we have over , unsolved murders in the UK and everything that I know about Fuller and how offenders operate. I say with some confidence that he killed again after . title: queen novel way eating bananas
story: Queen has novel way of eating bananas so she doesnt look like a gobbling monkeyAccording to a former royal chef, the Queen refuses to peel a banana like the rest of us and has a more unusual technique for eating the fruit Image: Getty ImagesByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsEating a banana while trying to look elegant can prove to be quite dficult - but not for the Queen. Thataposs because according to a former royal chef she has an unusual technique for eating the fruit so she doesnapost look like a gobbling monkey. Unlike the rest of us, Her Majesty refuses to peel and then eat it, instead, she peels it with a kne and fork. According to Darren McGrady, who once worked in the royal kitchens, the Queen would cut the top and bottom off, then slice the skin away -ways. She then chopped it up into small pieces before eating them with a fork.  Being strict about the way she eats bananas isnapost the Queenaposs only food quirk. She will never eat or serve, garlic - even on formal occasions. Although she has good reasons behind this - itaposs because the royal family have to meet and greet so many people so never wants the smell of garlic on her breath. Shellfish is also a no go area as itaposs one of the foods most likely to cause food poisoning. However, it was recently reported the Queen has given up one of her nightly habits when it comes to food and drink.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Sheaposs now believed to be foregoing her nightly cocktail on the advice of doctors so she is as healthy as possible. It was said that the Queen, , enjoyed a martini most evenings although she is rarely seen drinking in public and isnapost a big drinker. But it is now thought Her Majesty is shunning alcohol altogether - except for at special occasions. Her decision to give up booze is not linked to any health issues and a palace source said: It is a recent and personal decision by the Queen. Meanwhile, a family friend told Vanity Fairaposs royal correspondent Katie Nicholl: The Queen has been told to give up her evening drink which is usually a martini. It’s not really a big deal for her, she is not a big drinker but it seems a trle unfair that at this stage in her le she’s having to give up one of very few pleasures.” Comment MORE ON The QueenRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: salt bae hiring toilet attendant
story: Salt Bae is hiring a toilet attendant - but itll take them  weeks to afford signature steakThe wages offered at the venue are only £-an-hour which would take any worker three weeks to buy just one of Nusr-Ets £ gold encrusted steaksSalt Baes customers tend to come from wealthy backgrounds Image: Nusr-Et InstagramByGraeme Murray:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsExclusive steak restaurant Salt Bae is looking to hire a toilet attendant - but many have pointed out that it would take three weeks for the chosen employee to afford their signature steak. The wages offered at the venue are ony £-an-hour which would take any worker three weeks to buy just one of Nusr-Etaposs £ gold encrusted steaks. Duties for wannabe employees, the restaurant says, include dealing with ious bodily fluids and, on occasion, dealing directly with the public. The role only pays between £. and £. per-hour plus tips from customers who will hopefully be generous. One of Salt Baeaposs customeraposs racked up a £,. bill which also included an additional % service charge of £,..  And that doesnapost include gts from customers, with another table tipping Salt Bae himself a £ box of cigars. In the online job advertisement, the restaurant says the successful candidate must be health and safety conscious, as well as honest, trustworthy and punctual. But the would-be worker is unlikely to spot the boss because he is reportedly leaving London to set up a new restaurant in Saudi Arabia. Nusr-Et will not be there to show off his tableside skills for adoring fans such as Wayne and Coleen Rooney, according to reports.Diners have previously shelled-out £ for prime reservations at the Knightsbridge eatery which The Sun claimed has been accused of treating staff badly. Among the items featured on the menu are a £, gold -gilded tomahawk steak while a slightly cheaper £ will get you a hunk of beef or a burger will set you back £. The restaurant, meanwhile, charges £ for a single glass of coke. The job advert reads: Successful applicants for this position will be responsible for the safety, security, cleanliness and proper use of our toilets in the restaurant. Duties include cleaning and servicing the bathroom, ensuring the facilities are secure and safe and keeping up social-distancing measures.  The description states the successful candidate must be health and safety conscious, as well as honest, trustworthy and punctual. Though only in London for a short time, Salt Bae has hit the headlines with many wealthy guests having been keen to attend the restaurant . Since the restaurant opened on September , people with money have turned up to have the Salt Bae treatment. One diner took to social media to show the £, bill for dinner at the exclusive steakhouse . He said the bill included a Golden Tomahawk steak at £,  Nusret Baklavaaposs - a traditional Turkish dessert typically served with Matei Radulescu, a Turkish ice cream, at a total of £, one sautéed broccoli , a portion of asparagus , three herb crusted friesand one side of mashed potato . The Mirror also told how a vintage  bottle of Petrus was £, alone, while two bottles of  Petrus were also consumed at a whopping £, - each. news uk-news savvy-couple-turn-british-gas-"Campervans: UK’s ‘Coolest Campers’ discuss van conversionByDouglas Patient:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA savvy couple has renovated a British Gas van into a quirky home for £,. Laura Evans, and Ed Knight, both , set themselves a challenge of making a Caddy Maxi van into a liveable space. The couple from Kingston-upon-Thames, London, deliberately purchased a small van to show others that home on wheels doesn’t always have to be big. The ‘adventure van’ was once used for workers of an energy and home services provider but now it is kitted out with a kitchen and bed. The couple used repurposed materials such as wood and even made a skyline roof by inserting a square window. Laura, who is a shop assistant, said: “It took four months for us to rip everything out, insulate and convert it into a mini camper. “We wanted to challenge ourselves and be creative as the pandemic put a halt on our international travel plans. “The van was in excess of £,. “And it cost £, on the mechanical work and materials such as reclaimed wood for the , the bed frame and small cupboards.“We tried to cut costs as much as we can by purchasing stuff from Facebook marketplace such as Moroccan tiles for the kitchen.“But we bought the oven brand new to ensure it worked.” All appliances such as the oven with a hob, fridge with freezer, tap with an electric pump, LED lighting, l fresh water and full solar system including a leisure battery were brand new.  But the stone sink was purchased from Facebook marketplace but was too big. Laura adds: The solution was to apossinkapos our basin into the unit and let the countertop form around. We love this finish and we believe it looks better thanwe had just simply placed it on top. Just like the kitchen doors, we used Scottish Elm for our countertops but kept the live edges and Eddy cleverly used a jigsaw to cut a waney edge to follow the curvy doors at the end of each unit.  Eddy made solid Elm shaker doors in the kitchen with close weave Rattan  which is a natural cane woven material. It is a biodegradable material which looks amazing. From the outside, the blue vehicle looks like any other Volkswagen van but inside it is a shabby chic space. With a wooden ceiling and laminate flooring, the van boasts enough room for two people but one cannot stand due to the low ceiling.  Ed said: “This is an adventure van - used for sleeping and eating. Itaposs perfect for curling up in bed and watching a movie but it is built as an adventure van so not one for spending days inside. “We loved seeing people’s reaction when we have opened the door in a public place. “They always had to double-take - especiallythey see us with a meal as you would never think there is a working kitchen in it.  “We wanted to show others that you don’t need a massive van to make a home. “We still have our home comforts such as fluffy pillows and a comfy mattress but you can’t stand up.” Ed, who is a joiner, insulated the van and did most of the handy work whilst Laura focused on bargain hunting and interior. The couple spent eight hours per day over eight weeks transforming the van into a living space.  They went on to travel around Cornwall and Isle of Skye, Scotland, before selling it. Ed said: “Laura did the finishing touches too such as most of the painting, oiling and sanding. It is much better to buy an ex-service van because it has been looking after and the mileage is good. “With clever designs, you can do it cheaper - making it better in the long run. “Laura lost her job in events as a result of the pandemic in December . “She began working part-time so this gave her something more to focus on. “We spent a total of £, and made some profit when selling it on. title: uk weather forecast map shows
story: UK weather forecast: Map shows Tropical Storm Wanda barrelling towards BritainThe Met Office is tracking Tropical Storm Wanda which is on its way towards the UK and is expected to bring unsettled weather when its remnants reach Britains shoresA map shows Tropical Storm Wanda over the Atlantic barrelling towards BritainByDouglas Patient:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA map shows Tropical Storm Wanda over the Atlantic barrelling towards Britain as mph gales and heavy rain batter the country this weekend. It is forecast to bring sustained winds to the UK by Tuesday and a US National Hurricane Centre map shows it headed right for the country. This comes as there is currently a yellow warning for wind in place for northern Scotland until pm on Sunday. The warning states: Strengthening west to north westerly winds will bring gusts of -mph perhaps locally mph, to exposed locations of northern Scotland. “These winds initially across the Western Isles and north west mainland Scotland on Saturday evening, spreading to the north east mainland and Orkney overnight and Sunday morning. “In combination with high spring tides this is expected to lead to large waves around the coasts. Winds gradually easing through Sunday afternoon.” Britain is set for more unsettled next week as remnants of Tropical Storm Wanda arrive from Tuesday. Met Office forecaster Dan Harris said: “Tropical Storm Wanda is not too far from the UK - and may indirectly influence the forecast early next week.”Netweather and STV forecaster Jo Farrow added: “If Wanda gets caught up with another Atlantic low pressure, its tropical energy could help bring wet and windy weather to the UK.”It is currently over the Atlantic Ocean and will move north eastwards during the course of the weekend. On Sunday night Wanda is expected to weaken and be downgraded to a non-tropical feature, and what is left of the storm will become embedded within a larger Atlantic frontal zone, the Met Office said.  This will then move across the UK on Tuesday and Wednesday. The Met Office said it could lead to rainfall and potentially weather warnings - although the timing and track of the system is still uncertain. UK forecast for next five days Today: Windy, especially across northern and eastern Scotland where gales or severe gales and high gusts expected. Many areas will be dry with sunny spells, but some showers are likely in the north and west and the Midlands. Colder than yesterday. Tonight: Daytime showers fading this evening leaving many areas dry and chilly with clear spells overnight. Turning cloudier with rain at times in the west later. Becoming less windy. Monday: Bright at first in the south and east, then turning cloudier later but remaining mainly dry. Cloudier and windier in the north and west with rain at times, especially later. Outlook for Tuesday to Thursday: Cloud and rain moving southeast through Tuesday with blustery showers following in the north. Cloud and outbreaks of rain in the south likely ing north midweek. Mild in the south. title: woman 40 followed strange man
story: Woman, , followed by strange man while on walk in early hours saved by her dogLorraine had taken her dog for a run at am when the man started to walk towards her slowly but thankfully her four-legged friend was on hand to scare him offLorraine Scotts German shepherd, TobyByAnnie Williams:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA woman said she doesnapost know what would have happened to herher dog hadnapost scared away a strange man following her in the early hours of the morning. Lorraine Scott was out with her dog in Wirral early this morning when she got spooked by a strange man approaching her car. Lorraine, who is from Birkenhead, was taking her German shepherd dog Toby for a run on Leasowe beach at around .am this morning when she got freaked out by a stranger following her.The -year-old told the Liverpool Echo : “I turned into the car park for the beach and I spotted this maroon car on my right hand side.“I carried on driving down towards the steps to the beach because it’s easier for the dog and parked by a vacant car.  “I then started to sort everything out, like get my wellies on and get Toby sorted and noticed that the maroon car must have turned around from the way he was facing when I drove in as it was pulling up beside the vacant car by me. “I knew whoever it was had seen that I was on my own when I drove past, but I didn’t think anything of it at this point.” Lorraine said she continued to prepare for her run when she noticed a man get out from the car and begin slowly making his way towards her. She said he was scanning the area intensely while walking towards Lorraine’s passenger seat. Lorraine said: “At this point I started to get really panicky and I just froze. “I couldn’t really do anything, I just froze.” The man continued to slowly approach Lorraine but it was at this point that three-year-old Toby saw him getting ‘too close’ and began to react to his ‘strange’ presence. Lorraine said: “Toby started barking and going mad at him and then straight away the man jumped and ran straight back into his car and drove away very quickly. “I’m just really happy I had my protector with me. He’s naturally a protective breed and because of our bond he will always protect me.”  Lorraine said the incident freaked her out as she has never been in a situation like that before and despite being trained in kickboxing she didnapost know how to react.Writing about the incident on a community Facebook page, Lorraine said: “If I had been on my own, this might have been a dferent story - luckily my German shepherd is protective of me.“Iaposve been at this beach before and never had anything like this happen and there is always people camping the night there so never usually though anything strange about people being parked up there. “Hopefully this post will make people aware there are some weirdos about and to be extra careful, so glad I have a German shepherd to protect me.” The man was said to be wearing a black tracksuit and and black crew neck t-shirt. He had a shaved head with blonde hair, was of a slim build and approximately ft  in height from what Lorraine could make out. Lorraine says she is still shaken up after the incident and in future she will continue to walk Toby with her husband like she would usually do. title: your booster jabs now avoid
story: Sajid Javid warns Brits to get booster jabs now to avoid Christmas Covid rulesSajid Javid, the Home Secretary, said that  we all come together and play our part then the country can avoid ato restrictions allowing everyone to enjoy ChristmasA patient receiving a Covid- vaccine booster, as urged by the Health Secretary Image: PAByLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments Elderly and vulnerable people have been urged to get their Covid- booster jabs as part of a national mission to help dodge a restricted Christmas.Sajid Javid, the Home Secretary, said thatwe all come together and play our part then the country can avoid ato restrictions.So far, almost  million people in the UK have received a top-up jab, but the Department of Health and Social Care said that around  per cent of over-s and  per cent of over s in England are still yet to receive the booster shot. People over  and those most at risk from Covid- are eligible for a booster six months after their second jab, with  million more people in England being invited to have their booster jabs next week. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Mr Javid said: We know immunity begins to wane after six months, especially for the elderly and the vulnerable, and booster vaccines will top-up their protection to keep people safe over the winter. He added that younger relatives should urge eligible parents and grandparents to take up both the offer of a booster and a flu vaccine. Javid said: Almost  million people in the UK have received their Covid- booster and third jabs, a phenomenal achievement in under two months. “As we approach this milestone, I want to thank those who have come forward and urge everybody across the nation to get vaccinated, get protected and get boosted.  He went on: “I strongly urge everybody who is eligible for a Covid- booster or flu vaccine to take up the offer as soon as you can. “For those not yet eligible, please help your parents, grandparents or vulnerable loved ones get their jabs, it could save their le.“Andyou haven’t yet had your first and second vaccines, it is not too late, the NHS will always be there to welcome you with open arms.“This truly is a national mission. If we all come together and play our part, we can get through this challenging winter, avoid ato restrictions and enjoy Christmas.” It is possible that in the future, a third jab could become a requirement to avoid travel restrictions - a move which is expected to further drive the uptake of boosters.Government guidelines state that people who are  and over, or aged  and over with a health condition that puts them at high risk of contracting Covid-, and had their second dose six months ago are eligible to get their booster. By next week,  million invitations will have been sent since the NHS booster programme began. title: sacked amazon driver says woman
story: Sacked Amazon driver says woman sneaking out of his van is his partnerTywan George, the driver of the vehicle, revealed the woman in the video is his partner and insisted he was just doing his job. He was sacked after the video went viralThe mystery blonde woman emerging form the back of the Amazon vanByGraeme Murray:,  Nov | commentsA sacked Amazon driver says a woman seen sneaking out the back of his van is his partner - as he hinted at what really happened between them. In the bizarre clip, the woman is spotted crawling out of the back door of driver Tywan Georgeaposs van.The footage went viral on TikTok, and one week later Tywan was sacked.He has now revealed the woman in the video is his partner and insisted he was just doing his job.Tywan told a TMZ reporter in a video call: It was just a one time incident, but I did what any other man in America would do.  He continued: I felt like losing my job was the worse that they could do to me, there was no packages reported missing, nothing was reported stolen. It was just the incident went viral, thataposs what cost my my job. I kind of knew it too once Iaposd seen the video going viral, once it got a million views on TikTok, I kind of knew it because I know Amazon are strict. Answering questions specically about what he was doing in the back of the truck in the viral video, he said he was just doing his job. Filmed in July, , in a residential neighbourhood, of Florida, the clip shows the doors slowly being pushed open. A blonde woman dressed in a black dress and flip flops is then seen sneaking out the door and casually going on her way. She looks like she is taking a phone from her dress to make a call as she leaves the van.The clip emerged on TikTok and has gathered more than  million views.Users of the social networking  started going into a frenzy in the comment section and posted puns and innuendos about what had been going on. One poster wrote: Package will be delivered in  months. Thank you While another suggestive comment said: He was just showing her his package Others suggested it was a new service provided by the delivery giant: This is Amazons new back door service! news weird-news beautician-horried-client-turns-up-"Lash technician horried by clients eyelash extensionsByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsThereaposs no better feeling than heading to the salon to get a fresh set of lashes, but while you might want to keep the price down, itaposs important to go to someone who knows what theyaposre doing. Of course, administering eyelash extensions is a very particular skill, and being so close to the eye, thereaposs a lot that can go wrong in the wrong hands. So, you can understand just how horried one lash technician was, when she had a client come in to have a set of botched lashes removed, after an unqualied beautician stuck them on using hair bonding glue. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.TikTok user IPS Beauty @ipsbeautytook to the app to share a clip of the botched lashes, insisting it should be illegal for any client to be left with their lashes in such a poor state.A client came in for a removal today, I was horried, the technician wrote on the clip. Extensions applied with hair bonding glue and zero isolation. This should be ILLEGAL! The beautician went on to explain how her client had been left with very few of her own lashes after trying to remove the extensions at home resulted in her pulling most of her lashes out. Ouch. Look at how sparse her natural lashes are. She came to me like this so the other lashes were probably ripped out, she wrote. Understandably, the beauticianaposs followers were also left horried over the lashes, with many accusing the person who did the botched job as a aposfakeapos. What is wrong with all these FAKE lash techs! If you can’t do it properly don’t do it, one follower commented, while another added: Iaposm still f**king learning and I can do better.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news homeowner-thought-carpet-chic-grey-"HOMEOWNER THOUGHT CARPET WAS CHIC GREY COLOUR UNTIL HOUSE WAS PROFESSIONALLY CLEANEDByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Nov | commentsWhen something has been left to get really dirty and disgusting, it can be rather satisfying to watch it get cleaned andto its proper state. Brandon Anderson, who helps professional cleaners find clients, recently showed off a video of someone doing just this to a filthy carpet. However, viewers who saw the clip on TikTok were horried by the sheer amount of dirt involved - as they initially just assumed that the carpet was a chic dark grey colour. But as the expert went at the fabric with a steam cleaner, the carpet can be seen to completely transform back to its original shade. And it wasnapost meant to be grey at all - it was in fact beige. The carpet had so much dirt and grime in it that it had darkened over time due to lack of care. Thousands of people have watched the clip, mesmerised by the cleaning process.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. One person replied: But HOW ! Another said: This is why I HATE carpet. I donapost believe it, proclaimed a third. Someone  wrote: GROSS.  My eyes went from wide to wider, admitted a dferent user. A sixth person added: Throw away the whole house. Others thought that it was nasty and shared comments with the vomiting emoji. This comes after a dferent TikTok user had a similar experience with the laminate flooring in their new home. Posting under the name @dandycleans she uploaded a clip on to the social media  showing her scrubbing a section of her floor and as she wipes, it becomes lighter and lighter. The video was captioned: When I moved in I just thought the floor was dark. The floor initially did appear to be dark, but her hard work soon reveals the regular laminate flooring underneath. More than , people watched her clean, with over , liking it. However, some people werenapost quite so impressed, with a few wonderingsheaposd actually cleaned the floor or just removed the stain. But @dandycleans was quick to insist that it was laminate flooring and it really was just THAT dirty. Have you ever made a gross discovery like this  Let us know in the comments below. news weird-news i-thought-tinder-date-stood-"TikToker recalls finding Tinder date naked in his carByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsItaposs no secret that online dating can be a bit of a minefield, and more often than not, when do you meet up with a match, youaposre never entirely certain how itaposs going to go. Sometimes it can go great, but sadly, thataposs not always the case, and many daters have experienced being catfished, or arguably worse their date not showing up at all. One woman has revealed how she thought her date had done a runner halfway through their date, after he disappeared for  whole minutes after conveniently aposforgetting his wallet.aposTikTok user Ashleigh @hai_im_ashleigh_had been speaking to her date aposPaulapos for several months before they were able to finally meet up, due to conflicting schedules, but when he heard she was hanging out at a shopping centre near where he lived, he offered to come over and meet her.  Since Ashleigh was with a friend, Paul offered to treat them both to dinner and she admits he seemed to be a very nice guy. We met him at a LongHorn steakhouse - he shakes her hand and hugs me, she explained in a TikTok clip. Once we get to the door [of the restaurant], he starts patting his pants and goes aposoh my god, I left my wallet [in the car]. Go ahead and put our name on the waitlist.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. More than  minutes later, Paul hadnapost come back, prompting Ashleigh and her friend to believe theyaposd been stood up, so they left and decided to get a McDonaldaposs instead. So I was sitting there, almost in tears, because I really liked this guy, she continued. And me and my friend just decide to leave and go grab some McDonaldaposs because I wasnapost really in the mood to get a steak dinner at that point. But, as they were leaving the restaurant, the pair noticed Paulaposs car parked up nearby, so Ashleighaposs friend decided to march up to the vehicle and confront him. My friend went up to the car and let out a scream, Ashleigh recalled, adding that she quickly ran over to see what all the fuss was about. Me being the nosy a** I am, went up to the car, looked in and saw this man butt a** naked. title: mum mortified after double spray
story: Mum mortied after double spray tan leaves her looking like Ross from FriendsDerrie Mathews asked her beautician to do her spray tan twice to counteract her pale complexion, but she woke up looking like Ross from Friends after his epic spray tan failDerrie asked the beautician to spray her twice because she was so pale Image: Derrie Mathews   SWNSByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsA mum has been left feeling mortied after a hilarious spray tan fail left her resembling Ross from Friends. Derrie Mathews had no one to blame but herself, after asking the beauticianshe could be sprayed twice, in a bid to compensate for her apossuper paleapos natural red head complexion. The -year-old went to get the £ treatment two days before a wedding in order to give her winter skin a warm, summer glow - but she couldnapost quite believe her eyes when she woke up the next morning. I was going to a wedding, and Iaposm super, super pale - I am really freckly and white. So, I just asked the girlshe would do it twice, so much darker, Derrie explained. At first, the mum didnapost notice much of a dference to her complexion and it wasnapost until she woke up the following day that she realised sheaposd made a huge mistake. Derrie said: You have to leave it on for eight hours and then wash it off after, and it was just getting darker and darker and darker. But I didnapost wash it off after eight hours because it stops developing then. On Friday morning, when she awoke and looked in the mirror, she couldnapost believe the shade that sheaposd turned, much to the amusement of her husband.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. l was aghast at what I looked like. My husband couldnapost stop laughing, and my daughter was petried that anyone would see me. I knew I looked so ridiculous, so I didnapost tell him not to do it. I fully deserved everything! Derrieaposs double spray tan blunder is reminiscent of the famous Friends episode, in which Ross misunderstands the tanning booth, and ends up getting sprayed with two twos - twice! She said: When the girl did it, my friend was with me, and I was saying, aposIaposm an eight, Iaposm an eightapos because thataposs what Ross says! But despite her tanning experience not quite going to plan, Derrie hasnapost been put off spray tans and says sheaposll definitely be ing in the future. I will go back - it makes me feel better when I have a tan, she said. Itaposs nice to have a little bit of colour, but not the boot polish look - itaposs not for me, I must say.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news nurses-mind-blown-mum-tells-"Nurse shares most unfortunate baby name shes ever heardByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Nov | commentsWhen it comes to name pronunciation, itaposs no secret that there are some incredibly complicated and unique names out there. Then there are the more common names, that most people have absolutely no problem whatsoever saying out loud.However, every now and then it seems thereaposs a crossover between the two and this is where it gets tricky, as a parent takes a popular name and decides to alter the pronunciation - but keep the spelling the same.One woman has recounted an awkward situation she found herself in after getting a childaposs name wrong.Taking to TikTok, the nurse, known only as Lindsey, admitted that sheaposs bad with names but didnapost think she could butcher the name Liam after she saw it on a patientaposs file. She said: Iaposm a paediatric nurse and Iaposm from the deep, deep south, so I butcher everybodyaposs name. If itaposs not something super simple like Ben or Sally, Iaposm gonna butcher it. So, I see a kidaposs name on our computer and I say aposOh, Liam, I got this. L-I-A-M. Liam. Easyapos. I go out, call the kidaposs name, nobody moves. Call him again. Nobody moves. Call him again nobody moves. Finally this mum stands up and says aposDo you mean aposYum apos And I say aposNo, Liam apos and she said aposYeah, itaposs short for Williamapos. Lindsey finishes the video by doing a mind blown gesture, adding boom.Her clip went viral, being watched more than three million times and garnering over , likes.Thousands of people also commented, with one saying: My sonaposs name was Liam. His new name is Yum.Another replied: As a mum of a Liam, I am perturbed. Others began sharing unfortunate and amusing names theyaposd come across. Someone  said: Had a student named Justin, last name Case. He said aposMy mom thinks she has a sense of humourapos. Had a patient named L-A, I called for LA. Mom quickly informed me itaposs pronounced Ladasha and did I not see the dash  Ummm ok, added a dferent user.Whataposs the most unique name youaposve ever heard  Let us know in the comments below. title: two ghosts live house one
story: Two ghosts live in our house - one threw scissors and other predicted my babys sexCouple Lainey and Ben tell their scary tale of poltergeists who live in their home and are now Tik Tok famousLainey Clark and Ben Hubbard went viral with their Tik Tok haunted house videos Image: Ben Hubbard and Lainey ClarkByKirsten JonesFeatures  Lestyle Writer:,  Nov | commentsTeachers Lainey Clark,  and Ben Hubbard, , went viral with their Tik Tok haunted house videos - now their ghostly lodgers are famous.Lainey Clark says: aposI always hoped that spirits existed, but never saw anything until my mum died.I was in my early twenties and soon after she passed, she came to me in a dream and said, “I’m here to tell you I’m OK and I’m happy.” It was so real and I’ve felt settled ever since, knowing she’s not suffering any more. I met Ben when I was , having just left my husband of  years. We were teaching in the same school and bonded immediately – after I had given him a telling off for not doing his job properly! We moved in together three months later, in the summer of .Our little house was perfect, but odd noises kept us up at night. We’d hear footsteps on the stairs and despite it being a new build, we put it down to creaky floorboards and cooling pipes.Then subtle sounds became a whole lot scarier. One afternoon, Ben was out and I was happily relaxing in the bath when I heard a male voice call my name. I froze – maybe it was the old tenants  Nervously, I called out, “Who’s there ” but the house was silent. I was shaken to the core, but I didn’t tell Ben. We were still in the early days of our relationship and I didn’t want to seem like a madwoman! But that all changed a few weeks later. We’d just finished dinner and popped the telly on, ready for a chill evening on the sofa. Out of nowhere, our pot plant shted across the shelf in front of us and dropped to the floor. We both stared in disbelief – the hairs stood up on the back of my neck. We couldn’t deny it now, our house had a poltergeist. It shattered everything I felt I knew about le. Brought up in a strict Catholic family, I was taught that there’s no such thing as ghosts. But now I know they’re very real.Moving house costs a fortune, we couldn’t afford to just jump up and leave. I felt like I couldn’t talk about what I was experiencing, scared of losing respect at work. We had to come to terms with it and initially had no intention of sharing our story. Then, two years later, we decided to find others who were experiencing hauntings, to help us feel less alone. We thought we’d be laughed at, but it turns out haunted houses are quite common. We started off scared of the ghost but thought, well,it’s gonna get us, it’s gonna get us. It’s massively frustrating when we’re woken up in the night, or when a door slams in our faces, but we cope OK. There are actually two spirits in our house. Dave is always here – he’s thought to be attached to us, not the house. He was the first spirit to reveal himself. A psychic told us his name, and his frustration that we weren’t acknowledging him. But things have calmed down a lot. It’s like living with an invisible housemate, who’s made it known that his favourite food is spam!When we moved in I had really bad headaches. We’ve recently discovered that Dave passed away in a car accident – he had a blow to the side of his head, the same side as my headaches. The other spirit, Andy, is the late brother of the psychic medium who investigated our house – we think Dave and Andy have actually bonded! My scariest moment was when Ben was away. I was startled awake to the sound of growling in my ear. I started recording on my phone to document what had happened and watched as a spirit lted my hair from my shoulder. That felt too close for comfort.I sought advice from experts who told me to set boundaries with the spirits and it hasn’t happened again. I never feel alone in the house and I’ve come to love living with spirits. Sometimes it’s so quiet we wonderthey’ve gone. There’s a lot of activity when we’re stressed or anxious, so they must feed off our negative energy. Using a ouija board, I asked Dave and Andythey’d protect our unborn baby – they said yes. Dave was convinced the baby would be a boy. We recently found out the gender at a scan and he was right. I was gobsmacked! People probably think we’re absolute idiots, that we have demons in our house and we’re putting our unborn child at risk. But there’s no heaviness or bad vibes here. There’s le beyond death, and that’s all I’ve ever wanted to hear.Ben Hubbard says: aposAs a kid, I had a love-hate relationship with horror movies. I liked to get scared, but always had in the back of my mind that they weren’t real – now I’m living in my own version of a Hollywood blockbuster.  I remember seeing shadows out of the corner of my eye, or feeling someone watching me in my own home.But I was a sceptic – I wouldn’t believe it was a ghost, let alone two of them! When objects started moving in the house, I was terried. I’d seen The Conjuring movies – I thought we were going to die. Soon we were coming home to a pigsty – our possessions thrown around in a mess. So we decided to put up motion-activated cameras to capture Dave and Andy in action. One day, I watched a pair of scissors fly out of the kitchen drawer. I don’t want to think about what would have happened we were in the way at the time. A few weeks later, I woke up to use the loo during the night. I looked up to see the outline of a man standing right in front of me. My jaw hit the floor. I was definitely awake and my mind was in overdrive. It couldn’t be real – could it  We speak to Dave and Andy using a spirit board and a ghost-hunting app. They’re the budget options, because it’s not cheap chatting to ghosts! Dave loves winding me up. I was alone one day playing FIFA and saw something move out of the corner of my eye.I leapt up and left the house. Lainey came home hours later to find me sitting barefoot on the doorstep looking sad – I feel way more comfortable when Lainey is with me! Most people say our house feels happy and calm, but a few friends hate it. A mate offered to house-sit while we went away. A few hours into our journey, he rang to say he’d heard footsteps walking across the room. In the early hours, he rang again saying, “I’ve posted your keys through the door. I’m leaving.” Apparently he’d been lying in bed when the duvet was pulled away – that was the final straw. He bolted and hasn’t been back since. Movies show ghosts throwing people down the stairs – I’m so grateful that we don’t have a basement, that would be game over. But it’s not so bad. Weird things happen now and then but it’s OK, we’re not possessed! We post very real footage of our spirits online but not everyone is willing to accept it. We’re not sharing stuff to make people believe. It helps us understand what’s happening and we love being part ofa paranormal community. At first I was very fearful, but now I love our spirits. news weird-news uks-most-haunted-castle-ghosts-"Northumberland: TikToker gets tour of ‘haunted’ Chillingham CastleByEdward KayNiche Video Journalist:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsSeeking out haunted locations and spooky spirits is a favourite pastime for many people nowadays, and this castle could top any ghost hunter’s wish list.Chillingham Castle in Northumberland has a storied history when it comes to paranormal activity, itaposs even been dubbed the most haunted castle in the UK. The castle has been the location of regular ghost sightings and has a brutal backstory dating back to the th century. This TikTok clip shows off some of the history of the castle as well as giving viewers a glimpse of the interior and some of the features. As the ghost tour around the castle explains, the building has been home to some blood curdling tales, including murder and torture. One room of note that is featured in the clip is The Edward Room, where King Henry III is said to have stayed. One guest’s ghost meter rapidly lit up in certain areas of this room, alluding to the presence of some paranormal spirits. Supernatural experiences are said to be rather common at the castle, with guests reporting incidents of pushing, hair pulling, voices being heard and even sightings of numerous ghostly figures. Staff in the castle are also said to have heard a loud voice telling them to “get out”.The video, which was uploaded by TikTok user @rebbeebee, shows off ious stops on the ghost tour of the castle, which was completed in darkness. Viewers were quick to share their stories of the castle, with one user commenting: “I stayed there and it scared the s**t out of me, we loved it though.” Another commenter wrote: “As we were leaving the chapel, someone put their hand on my shoulder… I was the last one in the group… other things happened while we were there.” A third added: “Went on a ghost hunt there years ago really spooky place, we even explored the graveyard just at the start of the castle driveway.” Comment MORE ON SupernaturalChillFrisk" data-immediate"data-immediate"Fancy an escape to the Chill newsletter for weekly inspiration and advice on UK holidays Sign Up!Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
