title: vale author details history welsh pubs new book
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityGraham Loveluck-Edwards has announced the release of his new book Historic Pubs of Wales where he relishes in some of the more colourful myths, legends and stories from Wales ancient past and oldest pubs.Included in the book is The Captains We, in Sully,a house originally owned by a captain."I have always loved old pubs, and we are blessed to have so many belters here in Wales," added Mr Loveluck-Edwards.Graham Loveluck-Edwards out snapping some pubs for his book "For example, the pub which claims to have an elephant buried under its beer garden, or the pub where funeral parties take a short cut to the cemetery through the bar to keep an ancient right of access alive, or the pub that claims to have invented pancake day and so many more."In all, Ive compiled over  incredible stories based around  amazing old pubs - is there any truth to them "Some for sure, but this book captures them and puts them in the context of history so you can be the judge."MORE NEWS:The book also contains a travel guide so readers can go on a tour around Wales and visit all the pubs in the book.You can find out more at www.talesfromhistoricpubsofwales.The book is available to buy now "As you can imagine for such a book the research was relentless and thorough, and a lot of fun," he added."Pubs have had such a tough time in the last year with us going in and out of lockdowns and with the introduction of social distancing measures."Sixteenth centuryinns are usually a warren of tiny rooms so being two metres apart has made opening and trading near impossible for many."So, a book which celebrates all that is great about our old pubs, which tells people their history, where to find them and what to expect when you get there has been welcomed by all landlords." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - title: lorna prichards howl comedy nights move paget rooms
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe line-up for thenight of Howl at its new Penarth premises" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowHeadliner Stuart Goldsmith " Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowLorna Prichard" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowSarah Bridgeman" Popular comedy night s with new venue - everything you need to knowDon Biswas" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA SELL-OUT comedy show, which will have you howling with laughter, is relaunching bigger and better than before.Howl comedy nights were founded by Lorna Prichard, starting at Cardfs Tramshed in .In  she left her job reporting for ITV Wales and ldquoswapped headlines for punchlines going into stand-up comedy Howlbecame a monthly event in Penarthrsquos Pier Pavilion in March .ldquoIt was very successful at Pier Pavilion, selling out to  maximum capacity most months, said Ms Prichard.ldquoI always try to curate a really ied, interesting line up of comedians, and my style of MCing is warm, energetic and a little bit chaotic, which seems to go down well."She planned to move the event to a bigger venue, with Penarth Town Council supporting the venture, then the Covid pandemic hit.Although live events were on hold, Ms Prichard kept busy shegot caught up in a whirlwind romance with a Brazilian called Leo ndash they dated long distance before meeting and getting engaged within  hours.ldquoThat descended into typical chaos, laughed Ms Prichard.ldquoI canrsquot wait to share my lockdown experiences with the audience.And share she will ndash with Howl ing for a monthly Saturday night show, with Glee Club level comedians, at Paget Rooms.ldquoIm so excited to be ing to Penarth, said Ms Prichard.ldquoBefore March  it was truly one of the highlights of my month.ldquoThe last  months have been so hard on us all, and we all need a laugh more than ever."Giving it a new home of the Paget Rooms means bigger shows with even bigger comedians, and I really hope Penarth is going to support us so I can keep coming back!Howl Comedy Night will , at the new venue, from .pm on Saturday November .Guests can expect an evening of fun, drinks, and laughter, featuring:STUART GOLDSMITH " alt"Penarth Times: Stuart Goldsmith " class"editor-image"Stuart Goldsmith An internationally award-winning comedian, writer, podcaster, and host. As seen on CBSrsquos Late Night With Conan OrsquoBrien, Russell Howardrsquos Stand Up Centraland As Yet Untitled ..removeHe is also the host of hit comedy podcast, The Comedians Comedian. With a reputation for smart, accessible stand-up, Stuartrsquos enthusiasm and natural charm conceal a quick wit and fearlessness.DON BISWASDon BiswasDon Biswas is one of the gems of the circuit. A politically charged gag merchant who likes to cover a wide range of subjects including his Asian upbringing, his dyspraxia and conspiracy theories.SARAH BRIDGEMANSarah BridgemanFor the last decade Sarah Bridgeman has been a hit with audiences all over the UK with her warm and friendly style. She has been a weird news commentator for BBC Radio Wales, a finalist for the Welsh national comedy competition WUSA , and has written a play based on her experiences in comedy.LORNA PRICHARDLorna PrichardLorna Prichard is a comedian from North East Wales. She is also a trusted broadcaster, having appeared regularly on TV and radio for the last  years. She can frequently be heard on BBC Radio Wales following the success of her weekly show, lsquoSummer Saturdays with Lorna Prichardrsquo.Since then she has been presenting in studio on a regular basis with rugby legends Jonathan Edwards and Nigel Owens, and covering for other presenters like Kiri Pritchard-McLean.Her warm, natural manner and charm endear her to audiences of all ages. She is a gted improviser who can keep her cool no matter what.Following the debut of Howl at Paget Rooms it willfora Christmas show on Saturday, December , with the line-up to be announced soon.Tickets for upcoming shows are available at ticketsource howl article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: altered myths launch single  revamped ep

We hibernated until the time was right.ldquoWeve been in Safehouse studio, in Oxford, putting together our next two EPs. We believe the world is ready to believe in us. will be the first track featured on the bandrsquos Revamped EPset to release in .The single includes a YouTube video, directed by Matik, which includes lyrics to the track, and graphics by Lee Waters.You can check it out at www.youtu.be ZlKxbMydncThe rockers, who have both been playing their instruments for more than  years, love performing to crowds ndash something thatrsquos been limited over the past  months due to the Covid pandemic.Matik has described their shows as an ldquoexhilarating clash of pantomime and mosh-pit therapy and people can get their fix at Altered Mythsrsquo upcoming headline show.They will be at Vulcan Lounge, in Cardf, on November  with support band Mawpit. The show will kick-off at pm, with tickets for pound on the door. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: llantwit major waterspout weather gets spooky
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJames Thomas, , an agent in the watersports industry, spotted the unusual phenomenon at Llantwit Major Beach in south Wales on Saturday morning.ldquoAs I stood there watching, I thought to myself, this is probably the best example of a waterspout that I will ever get to see in my letime, Mr Thomas told the PA news agency.ldquoOver the years I have seen quite a few of these over the Bristol Channel, but this was by far the biggest.Also known as funnel clouds or tuba, waterspouts form when a rotating column of wind draws in cloud droplets, according to the Met Office.Mr Thomas said he spied Saturdayrsquos weather spectacle while watching a surfing contest.ldquoIt started off fairly small, and quite high in the sky, and as we continued to watch, it appeared to get darker and began angling itself towards the surface of the sea, asit was coming towards us, he said.ldquoI quickly realised it was a waterspout when I could see the rotating spray on the waterrsquos surface, like a magnetic energy.ldquoI was shouting to all the competitors to look up and see this phenomenal natural occurrence.The sighting comes as the Met Office warned parts of the UK may have seen tornadoes on Sunday, as strong winds and rain batter the country.Gusts of over mph have been recorded and yellow warnings for wind and rain are in place over large parts of the west and where. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: help support bereavement
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENTSponsoredHelp and support through bereavementHere are of the best funeral directors that will offer just that and more.Green Willow FuneralsGreen Willows Funeral Home arealways at the heart of the community and the directors of Green Willow Funerals give their expertise, time and governance in a voluntary capacity. Their motivation is to ensure bereaved iniduals and families receive personal, respectful and affordable services and to ensure company profits are donated for charitable purposes.Furthermore, the directors set and promote an ethos and standards to which:The company and its staff will provide a transparent, compassionate service to its clients and the families that it serves.The approach to the client will be client-centred and, at all times, impartial professional advice will be provided, giving the client all options possible.We will enable and support the client and empower them to be the decision maker and, having provided the required information, ensure the client understands why they have made those decisions and that it remains appropriate to their needs.We will maintain professional fees that meet the needs of the company and its commitments and reflect the services provided however, these charges are not purely profit driven and are levied at a rate that provides a cost effective option to the clients and the communities that we serve when they are compared to the charges made by the companyrsquos competitors.All clients, regardless of gender, faith or belief are treated as equals. Green Willow Funerals is also an equal opportunity employer.As a company owned by a Christian and charitable body, the Cardf YMCATrust, the company and its staff aim to maintain and uphold in all matters Christian principles and teachings, althoughtheyare not required to be practising Christians.Phone: Newport |  Website:greenwillowfuneralsPark Funeral DirectorsWe continue to provide professional and respectful funeral services from our independent funeral homes situated in Barry, Vale of Glamorgan. Our establishment has been serving the local community for many years now. Park Funeral Directors are committed to ensuring your lost loved one receives the dignied and heartfelt send-off they deserve.Not to mention, your familyrsquos needs are our top priority, and we go above and beyond to ensure final wishes are met. As an independent, family-run funeral directors, we offer that extra personal touch to make sure the funeral service is as special as you envisage.We will bring your loved one into our care at either our Barry or Penarth site. Here, they will be treated with the utmost dignity and respect until the day of the funeral. Our facilities also offer tasteful and comfortable rest roomsin which you can spend time with the deceased in peace and solitude. Here, you will be able to share final moments of prayer or reflection with the deceased while in a safe and private setting. Our experienced staff will then guide you through the process of arranging the funeral, including sourcing memorials, flowers and stationery.We are committed to fulfilling the final requests of the deceased and their families. Therefore, you can rest assurethat any final requests will be followed to the letter wherever possible. If you have a funeral plan, your wishes will be carried out in accordance with your package.Alternatively, pre-determined requests of the deceased as well as those of the next of kin will be carried out. Our promise to you is that every funeral delivered by Park Funeral Directors will be conducted with the utmost in dignity and respect at all times.Phone:Barry |    Penarth |   Email:barry@parkfuneralsWebsite:parkfuneralsBrought to you byNEWSQUEST COMMERCIAL CONTENT s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: st athan railway station considered
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityVale of Glamorgan Council has commissioned a consultancy firm to investigate the possibility of creating a railway station in St Athan.In the past there were two train stations based near the village Gileston and St Athan Road, but these are closed. A third railway station, named St Athan despite being three kilometres to the west of the village near Boverton also no longer operates.But with the Vale of Glamorgan Line reopening in  and new stations located at nearby Llantwit Major and Rhoose Cardf International Airport, the Council wants to explore whether there is an opportunity to re-establish a station near St Athan.Consultants Arcadis will look at an area around a section of the B, Barry to Llantwit Major Road, to determinea suitable site exists.They will consider many factors, including:Those relating to environmental featuresLand informationPlanning constraintsStation requirements, such as vehicle, pedestrian, and cycle accessCllr John Thomas, Vale of Glamorgan Council Ward Member for St Athan, said:ldquoIrsquom delighted that we are looking into the possibility of locating a railway station at St Athan."It has been a long time since one existed in the village and with the local population growing it is sensible that we look into expanding public transport services.Cllr Peter King, Vale of Glamorgan Council Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood services and Transport, added:ldquoI understand the appetite for a railway station in St Athan so we have commissioned consultants to determine whether such a move is feasible.ldquoIncreasing the use of public transport is in keeping with the Councilrsquos Project Zero initiative to reduce carbon emissions so this is something we are very interested in investigating.Once Arcadis have completed the study, their findings will be reported, and the Council will consider whether to take the matter forward. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: wales vs south africa autumn nations match   stream watch tv
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe hosts take on World Champions South Africa just seven days after their - defeat to New Zealand.However, unlike in that game, recent history favours Wales when it comes to South Africa.Wales have toppled the Springboks four times in a row at home, with South Africa last departing the Welsh capital victorious eight years ago.Credit: PAldquoWe are always trying to develop our game, said centre Davies, who took over captaincy duties when Alun Wyn Jones went off injured after just  minutes of the New Zealand encounter.ldquoThe one thing this team always shows is that the more time we spend together, the better we get.ldquoWe will dust ourselves off, come in on Monday and look to build and get a result next week at home.ldquoItrsquos the fine details ndash not moving forward on kicks, executing our exits correctly and not putting pressure on ourselves.Credit: PAldquoThe way South Africa play, they want to put pressure on you. For us, itrsquos making sure we build and play in the right areas of the field.ldquoLook, you work extremely hard to get a result, and when you donrsquot get it, it does hurt.ldquoThe beauty of it now is we have another opportunity next week to put the wrongs right. That is what this group will want to show next week.How to watch Wales vs South AfricaThe only way to watch Wales vs South Africa live this year is with Amazon Prime Video.The streaming service secured a new deal to exclusively broadcast Walesrsquo autumn games.All teams, except for Ireland who will be broadcast on Channel , will have their games shown behind the paywall.Amazon Prime costs pound. per month.Credit: PAUsually, Walesrsquo games would also be shown live on SC, however, with Amazon offering a Welsh language service, there will be no live coverage on the free-to-air channel..removeHighlights of all Wales matches will be shown on the evening of the test, with the South Africa highlights starting at .pm on Saturday.Walesrsquo Autumn Nations Series fixturesWales  -  New ZealandWales v South Africa, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Fiji, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime VideoWales v Australia, Principality Stadium, November , .pm kick off, Amazon Prime Video article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: new building replace bowling pavilion belle vue park
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communitynew" New community building in Penarth park to get ‘hundreds of users a week’old" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentA NEW community building in a Penarth park is set to get hundreds of users a week, according to council bosses.The new building will replace the current bowling pavilion in Belle Vue Park, in Albert Crescent.Vale of Glamorgan councilrsquos planning committee approved permission for the replacement building last week.Councillor Kathryn McCaffer, cabinet member for leisure, arts and culture, said: ldquoThe new building will encourage a wide range of community groups to be able to use the space. Anyone who has attended a meeting or event in the current building can attest to how uninviting and inaccessible it is, and freezing cold.ldquoWhile itrsquos sad that the existing, dilapidated building needs to be demolished, it has had a long le which has mainly benefited the bowling club."I welcome the building of a new pavilion as a way to ensure the whole community is supported for future generations, so we can keep adding to the history of this location.David Knevett, operational manager for leisure and tourism, did not answer questions on the cost of the works, but expects hundreds of users each week.He said: ldquoThe new building is a considerable investment, and leisure services are keen that itrsquos used to its full potential. By combining community use, the use of the bowlers, and events, we are confident this can be achieved.ldquoWe feel the building provides a springboard for more community activity to take place in this area of Penarth. Wersquore really excited about this project and the opportunity this building will represent."A signicant amount of the cost is being funded through Section , and wersquove been fortunate enough to secure a grant from the lottery for this building.The new community building was welcomed by a local community group, Friends of Belle Vue, who took part in public consultations and fed into the final designs.The Friends Theo Hodgkinson said: ldquoWersquore really excited to see the positive impacts of having a purpose-built facility that is accessible to all age groups. Wersquore also excited about the energy-saving credentials of the building." article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: gannett foundation cash charities motion control dance
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMotion Control Dance caters to all ages and abilities lt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance is based in YMCA Barry " Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance has been serving the community for two decades lt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance caters to people all across the Vale of Glamorgan lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance aims to keep people healthy and avoid them feeling isolatedltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Motion Control Dance shortlisted for Gannett Foundation Cash for CharitiesMotion Control Dance was given charity status in  lt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentYOUR favourite local paper is giving local charities the chance to take a share of a whopping poundk cash giveaway.Our parent companyrsquos charitable arm, The Gannett Foundation, is providing pound, in cash to support local charities across the country - and we are delighted to have a pound, share to give away in our area.And we asked YOU to decide where this money should be spent. You nominated in your thousands and our editorial team chose a shortlist of eight charities from these nominations that will share in the pound,.In Wales the shortlist is:Motion Control DanceSparkleHelping Caring TeamWish Upon a StarPhoenix Bereavement SupportEthos - Extending The Hand Of Support .Chard  District MuseumSt Giles Animal RescueMotion Control Dance, based in the Vale of Glamorgan, was set-up by dance tutor Emma Mallam and aims to enrich the lives of people through movement." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance caters to people all across the Vale of Glamorgan " class"editor-image"She was teaching dance in England when her husband was diagnosed with a terminal brain tumor and the couple ed to Wales.ldquoI set up dance classes to keep myself busy, said Ms Mallam.ldquoI wanted to make a dference through movement as I watched my husband deteriorate and helped him by doing exercises and dancing with him to keep up his spirits.She sadly lost her husband in  and, along with looking after her baby, created a fulltime job doing giving people a ldquoChance  Dance.In  she became the dance development officer for the Vale with Vibe Experience and in  ndash addressing a lack of disability dancing provisions in the Vale ndash Local Motion Dance was introduced." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance was given charity status in  " class"editor-image"ldquoThis made us unique as we focused on community dance - using dance to help expression, confidence, self-esteem and to reduce isolation - rather than focus on exams and technical development, said Ms Mallam.Motion Control Dance - which gained charity status in  and is based at a studio in the YMCA Hub in Barry - caters to all ages and abilities, including older people. It caters for those with dementia, Parkinsonrsquos, the disabled, and mainstream groups..removeOver the past two decades they have worked with more than , iniduals each year, working in partnership with the Vale of Glamorgan Council and The Vale Youth Service, and delivering dance workshops." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance aims to keep people healthy and avoid them feeling isolated " class"editor-image"ldquoI am delighted how far Motion Control Dance has come, added Ms Mallam.ldquoWe have a team of experienced dance tutors who nurture the personal and social growth of our members.ldquoWe have employed two young people to undertake social media and administration and are training four young dance leaders to lead sessions - we want to provide opportunities for young people.ldquoWe also offer movement sessions for adults and older people this increased our mission to tackle social isolation in the community and give everyone a Chance to Dance.ldquoThe end of  saw our room be transformed into a fully equipped dance studio with a new sprung floor ensuring we are enriching lives through movement. Motion Control Dance is now thriving in our community.She is ldquoabsolutely thrilled to be one of eight chosen Welsh charities and has thanked the community." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance is based in YMCA Barry " class"editor-image"Money would help Motion Control Dance recover their services for older people in the Vale during the Covid pandemic classes went virtual.ldquoWe built a busy programme in , but since Covid we have been unable to run our full programme indoors at our studio or at care homes and community centres, said Ms Mallam.ldquoMany vulnerable adults and older people requiring care are continuing to self-isolate or are too fearful to attend indoor activity to be responsive to a iety of restrictions imposed we need financial support, so we can deliver an accessible movement programme for older people which can be taken to people and adaptive to their needs.ldquoOur goal is to reduce social isolation and prevent more costly health and social care needs by improving the health and wellbeing of iniduals through access to regular physical, creative and social activity." alt"Penarth Times: Motion Control Dance has been serving the community for two decades " class"editor-image"Now we are putting the power to allocate the cash back into the hands of our readers ndash during November, you are invited to collect tokens from our newspapers which can then be sent to collection points across our region or posted.Each token collected will then be used to allocate cash to the nominated charity - soyour favourite charity collects  per cent of all the tokens collected, it will receive  per cent of the pound,.Collection points are at:WH Smith, Windsor Road, PenarthTown News Xtra, Holton Road, BarryMCD Studio, YMCA Hub, Court Road, Barry. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - title: wales mps making thousands extra cash
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe most recent parliamentary Register of Members Interests shows that MPs accepted tickets to sporting and music events worth hundreds of pounds, while others engaged in highly paid consultancy work for global firms.Since April , the basic pay for a Member of Parliament has been pound, per year. On top of this, MPs are permitted to make expense claims for their commute between Parliament and their constituency.They also receive heavily discounted food and drink at parliament, subsidised by public money.Yet many MPs in Wales continue to accept lucrative work from private companies alongside their role as an elected representative, hold shares in private companies, and accept valuable gts.Perhaps the most high profile example this past year was Alun Cairns, MP for the Vale of Glamorgan, and Secretary of State for Wales before his  resignation over an aidersquos involvement in the sabotage of a rape trial.:Disgraced Rob Roberts is given back Tory membershipMr Cairns accepted consultancy roles at BBI Group, a Caerphilly-based ldquoglobal le science and diagnostic company and at Veezu Holdings Ltd, a Newport-basedldquoprivate hire transport and technology  which owns Dragon Taxis, last year.BBI Group is a partner on the UK governmentrsquos Rapid Test Consortium and was contracted to provide lateral flow Covid- antibody tests in October .Mr Cairns earns approximately pound per hour for his work ldquoproviding strategic advice to the Board at the firm, totalling pound, per year on top of his MP salary. He makes the same amount for his role at Veezu. has three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. " alt"Penarth Times: Alun Cairnshas three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. " class"editor-image"Alun Cairnshas three consultancy jobs on top of his role as MP. This year Mr Cairns also accepted employment at Singapore-based asset management company Elite Partners Capital, which owns a number of UK commercial properties rented out by the government..remove:Jane Dodds MS says a UBI needs ambition to become a realityOn its website the company boasts: ldquoEighty-five percent of the assets are based in town centre locations and are core locations occupied by UK Government.ldquoSecured top grade tenant with over % of the income secured by the UK Government.Mr Cairns sits on the All Party Parliamentary Group on Singapore, which aims to ldquopromote and advance relations with Singapore. He earns approximately pound per hour in his role as a strategic consultant for Elite Partners Capital, adding up to pound, a year.Cairns also sits on the APPGs for Taxis and Financial Markets and Services.This Govt should always be there to support those who need help but the days of blank cheque benefits are over. #welfarepartymdash Alun CairnsJuly , A tweet by Mr Cairns from  reads: ldquoThis Govt should always be there to support those who need help but the days of blank cheque benefits are over. #welfarepartyldquoAll [my] roles have been scrutinised and approved by Parliamentrsquos independent advisory body, ACOBA, he told The Nationaltoday.Many of Mr Cairnsrsquo Welsh Conservative colleagues also registered extra income streams.:Westminster is in effect a free-for-allVale of Clwyd MP Dr James Davies, who practiced as a GP before entering Parliament, has, the parliamentary Register of Membersrsquo Interests shows, continued to work occasional shts - including NHS out of hours work.But while former Cabinet Minister Cairns is able to collect a pound, salary for  hoursrsquo work, Dr Davies had to put in  hours as a GP ndash spread over  months ndash to earn around the same amount." alt"Penarth Times: Dr James Davies, MP for Vale of Clwyd, made more than poundk working as a GP and received pound, from telecomms company IX Wireless " class"editor-image"Dr James Davies, MP for Vale of Clwyd, made more than poundk working as a GP and received pound, from telecomms company IX Wireless Current Welsh Secretary Simon Hart accepted pound, from Landsker Business Club this February. The Club is registered as an "unincorporated association" such groups are able to direct signicant funds to politicians without disclosing the identities of their members. The practice is legal.Hart received a further pound, from hwe Ltd, a strategic comms company.:Wales can lead the way on electoral reformThis past year Virginia Crosbie, Conservative MP for Ynys Mocircn, accepted pound, in donations from the Cayzer Trust, which manages the commercial interests of the billionaire Cayzer family. The trust owns controlling shares of financial giant Caledonia Investments.Crosbie also received a pound, donation in-kind from trust fund manager and Conservative stalwart Patrick Evershed in May this year. The money was received indirectly through a Conservative Party organisation." alt"Penarth Times: Ynys Mon MP Virginia Crosbie was elected in . " class"editor-image"Ynys Mon MP Virginia Crosbie was elected in . Mr Evershed is the president of the Cities of London and Westminster Conservative Association, and has previously told interviewers that he owns a cottage in north Wales.In all, Virginia Crosbie registered gts worth pound, over the past year. She also earnedpound, completing surveys for companies YouGov, Ipsos MORI and Yonder but all of those fees were paid directly to charity.She said, via email: ldquoI regularly receive donations and I use the money for the benefit of my constituents.ldquoFor example, I used one donation to pay for the distribution of a leaflet across the island on mental health. Other future initiatives in a similar vein will also use donations.ldquoI make no apology for using this money to help all my constituents on Anglesey.:What will the census show us about the state of Welsh This week both Ms Crosbie and Alun Cairns voted in favour of throwing out the current parliamentary standards watchdog, which investigates rule breaches and conflicts of interest, after the body recommended the suspension of MP Owen Paterson. Westminster later u-turned on the decision.MP for Bridgend Jamie Wallis receives more than pound, per year in rent from commercial properties in Bridgend. He also holds signicant shares in sixteen dferent companies, some worth thousands of pounds.Mr Wallis said:ldquoFollowing my election as the MP for Bridgend I resigned all my Company Directorships. Media, music and Clement AttleeA handful of Welsh MPs earn additional income from writing articles and books, while one even earned extra cash for performing in a rock band." alt"Penarth Times: Chris Bryant chairs the committee which found MP Owen Paterson had engaged in lobbying on behalf of companies that were paying him. " class"editor-image"Chris Bryant chairs the committee which found MP Owen Paterson had engaged in lobbying on behalf of companies that were paying him. Chris Bryant, Rhondda MP and Chair of the Parliamentary Standards Committee, has authored a number of books and also regularly contributes articles to publications such as The Daily , Theand Attitude.In addition to his MP salary, the Labour member earned an extra pound, , with fees ranging from pound for three hours presenting an LBC radio programme to pound, for the film rights to his book, The Glamour Boys.Bryant also picked up pound, in March for giving a talk on his book at an LGBTQ+ webinar organised by American investment bank Goldman Sachs.:Festival marks  Chartist Newport Rising anniversaryShadow Home Secretary and Torfaen MP Nick Thomas Symonds registered pound,. in additional income, with pound, apparently for legal services provided before entering parliament in .The remainder was made up of royalties for biographies that the former Oxford lecturer had written on Nye Bevan and Clement Attlee before entering parliament.According to his website, the Torfaen MP is currently working on his third book ndash a biography of former Labour PM Harold Wilson.Meanwhile, Kevin Brennan, MP for Cardf West, was paid pound. last November for a performance with his band ldquoMP at television writer Matt Fordersquos  Christmas Special stage show in London." alt"Penarth Times: MP Kevin Brennan released an album called Cross Party with his band of fellow MPs in . " class"editor-image"MP Kevin Brennan released an album called Cross Party with his band of fellow MPs in . Described as ldquothe worldrsquos only parliamentary rock band, MP consists of guitarist Brennan, SNP MP Pete Wishart on keyboards, Conservative and lead singer Sir Greg Knight, and former Labour MP Ian Cawsey.New Pontypridd MP Alex Davies-Jones, who sits on the APPGs for Music Education and Media, accepted Brit Awards tickets and hospitality worth pound from Google, as well as a pound ticket to the Ivor Novello music awards from the Betting and Gaming Council.Similarly, Jo Stevens, Cardf Central MP and Shadow Culture, Media and Sport Secretary, accepted nearly pound, in sporting event and music award tickets.:Starmers private sector optimism is out of dateSome Labour MPs also earned thousands completing surveys. Mark Tami, MP for Alyn and Deeside, earned more than pound, in a matter of months.And the rest Not all MPs reported extra income streams.One such MP, Cynon Valleyrsquos Beth Winter, told The National: ldquoBeing the MP for Cynon Valley is a great privilege. It is also a very time consuming and extremely well paid job.ldquoI fail to understand why any of my colleagues should feel the need to do second jobs, or where they find the time.ldquoMPs should be focused on serving their constituents, not lining their own pockets working for big business. Second jobs for MPs must be banned." alt"Penarth Times: Labour MP Beth Winter says second jobs for MPs should be banned, " class"editor-image"Labour MP Beth Winter says second jobs for MPs should be banned, Plaid Cymru MP for Ceredigion, Ben Lake, added: ldquoI find that my duties as an MP keep me busy enough, and so have never sought [extra income].Other MPs reporting no additional financial interests included Preseli and Pembrokeshire MP Stephen Crabb, Newport East MP Jessica Morden, Aberconwy MP Robin Millar and Arfon MP Hywel Williams.All named MPswere approached for comment.If you valueThe Nationalsjournalism, help grow our team of reporters bybecoming a subscriber.Are you sure you want to delete this comment Yes, delete the commentNo, keep the commentReport This CommentGet involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. launches in one afternoonA fishing vessel was towed in to Cardf Bay by a leboat" Leboat volunteers have busy Saturday with three launches in one afternoonIt was a busy day for volunteers at the RNLI" s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentLIFEBOATS were launched three times in one afternoon after sailors experienced some trouble near Cardf Bay.Volunteer RNLIcrews responded to the calls for help on Saturday, November .The first call came in at pm, with a  foot yacht running aground at low tide.A D-class leboat approached and ensured all four people on the yacht were safe, before securing the boats anchor and ing to their station.The leboat ed later on as the yacht refloated as the tiderose to ensure the wellbeing of all people on the boat and to provide assistancenecessary.At .pm, a fishing boat broke down and Milford Haven Coastguard requested that leboat crews attend.The crew were almost finished for the day after washing down the boat and gathering their things to go home.Nevertheless, they attended the scene in anAtlantic  leboat.The fishing vesselhad begun to drt out before droppingits anchor.It was towed in to Cardf Bay by the leboat crew. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey title: tensions rise iraqi pm survives assassination attempt
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityHelicopters circled in the Baghdad skies throughout the day, while troops and patrols were deployed around Baghdad and near the capitalrsquos fortied Green Zone, where the overnight attack occurred.Supporters of the Iran-backed militias held their ground in a protest camp outside the Green Zone to demand a vote recount. Leaders of the Iran-backed factions converged for the second day on a funeral tent to mourn a protester killed on Friday in clashes with security. Many of the faction leaders blame the prime minister for the violence. vw,vw,px, px"Iraqi prime minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kadhimi suffered a light cut and appeared in a televised speech soon after the attack by armed drones on his residence. He appeared calm and composed, seated behind a desk in a white shirt with what appeared to be a bandage around his left wrist.Seven of his security guards were wounded in the attack by at least two armed drones, according to two Iraqi officials.Mr al-Khadimi called for calm dialogue.ldquoCowardly rocket and drone attacks donrsquot build homelands and donrsquot build a future, he said in the televised speech.Condemnation of the attack poured in from world leaders, with several calling Mr al-Khadimi with words of support. They included Prime Minister Boris Johnson, French president Emmanuel Macron and Jordanrsquos King Abdullah II.Saudi Arabia called the attack an apparent act of ldquoterrorism. Egyptrsquos president Abdel Fattah el-Sissi on Facebook urged all sides in Iraq to ldquojoin forces to preserve the countryrsquos stability. vw,vw,px, px"Damage caused by the drone attack on the home of the Iraqi prime minister ldquoThe perpetrators of this terrorist attack on the Iraqi state must be held accountable, US president Joe Biden said in a statement..removeldquoI condemn in the strongest terms those using violence to undermine Iraqrsquos democratic process.Later on Sunday, Mr al-Khadimi met with Iraqi president Barham Salih and headed security and cabinet meetings.A security video showed the damage to his residence: a van parked outside the site badly mangled, a shallow crater near the stairs, cracks in the ceiling and walls of a balcony and broken parts of the buildingrsquos roof. Two unexploded rockets were filmed at the scene.There was no claim of responsibility, but suspicion immediately fell on Iran-backed militias. They had been blamed for previous attacks on the Green Zone, which also houses foreign embassies.The militia leaders condemned the attack, but most sought to downplay it.Dark times ahead for Iraq: Prime Minister Mustafa Kadhami has been attacked by Iran-aligned Shiite militias. For context, I wrote this for @BrookingsFP on why these are desperate times for Iran  its militias,  why this escalation has been in the making. https:t.co BSEHXVUamdash Ranj AlaaldinNovember , It was a dramatic escalation in the already tense situation following the October  vote and the surprising results in which Iran-backed militias lost about two-thirds of their seats.Despite a low turnout, the results confirmed a rising wave of discontent against the militias who had been praised years before as heroes for fighting so-called Islamic State militants.But the militias have lost popularity since , when they made big election gains. Many hold them responsible for suppressing the  youth-led anti-government protests, and for undermining state authority.The attack ldquois to cut off the road that could lead to a second al-Kadhimi term by those who lost in the recent elections, Bassam al-Qizwini, a Baghdad political analyst, said.ldquoThey started escalating first in the street, then clashed with Iraqi security forces, and now this.On Friday, protests by supporters of the pro-Iran Shiite militias became fatal when the demonstrators tried to enter the Green Zone where they had been camped out, demanding a recount. vw,vw,px, px"Security forces prevent protesters denouncing election results from storming the heavily fortied Green Zone during a protest in Baghdad on Saturday Security forces used tear gas and live ammunition. There was an exchange of fire in which one protester affiliated with the militias was killed. Dozens of security forces were injured. Mr al-Khadimi ordered an investigation.ldquoThe blood of martyrs is to hold you accountable, said Qais al-Khazali, leader of the Asaib Ahl al-Haq militia, addressing Mr al-Kadhimi in recorded comments to supporters. He blamed the prime minister for election fraud.In the strongest criticism of the prime minister, Abu Ali al-Askari, a senior leader with one of the hard line pro-Iran militias, Kataib Hezbollah, questioned whether the assassination attempt was really Mr al-Kadhimirsquos effort to ldquoplay the role of the victim.ldquoAccording to our confirmed information, no-one in Iraq has the desire to lose a drone on the residence of Mr al-Kadhimi, Mr al-Askari wrote in a Twitter post.ldquoIf anyone wants to harm this Facebook creature there are many ways that are less costly and more effective to realise that.Iranrsquos foreign ministry spokesman Saeed Khatibzadeh condemned the assassination attempt on Mr al-Khadimi and indirectly blamed the US. vw,vw,px, px"Damage caused by the armed drone attack on the Iraqi premierrsquos home in Baghdadrsquos Green Zone Mr al-Kadhimi, , was Iraqrsquos former intelligence chief before becoming prime minister in May last year. He is considered by the militias to be close to the US, and has tried to balance between Iraqrsquos alliances with both America and Iran.Meanwhile, Iraqrsquos election commission has yet to announce the final results. The parliament could then convene, elect a president and form a government.The US, the UN Security Council and others have praised the election, which was mostly violence-free and without major technical glitches.But the unsubstantiated fraud claims have cast a shadow over the vote. The standoff with the militia supporters has increased tensions among rival Shiite factions that could spill into violence and threaten Iraqrsquos newfound relative stability.Influential Shiite cleric Muqtada al-Sadr, who won the largest number of parliament seats in the October elections, denounced the ldquoterrorist attack, which he said sought toIraq to the lawlessness and chaos of the past.While Mr al-Sadr maintains good relations with Iran, he publicly opposes external interference in Iraqrsquos affairs..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Tensions rise after Iraqi PM survives assassination attempt article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: environment secretary claims sewage dumping concession mirrors peers demands
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityEnvironment Secretary George Eustice said the Government concession to be considered by MPs on Monday is ldquomirroring what peers have voted for in the Lords.But critics have argued that it does not require water companies to take action quickly, thereby allowing dumping to continue for many years to come.The Duke of Wellingtonrsquos amendment to the Environment Bill would place a new legal duty on water companies to ldquotake all reasonable steps to prevent sewage discharges.The independent crossbencherrsquos proposal was approved by the Lords last month by  votes to , majority .I feel slightly mean asking ppl to pile in on their MPs about the #Sewage amendment tomorrow, but hellip  its an MPs duty to do their best for their constituents, and  its matter of le and death ndash for us and our environment.mdash Jenny JonesNovember , This meant the Bill was sent back to the Commons for further consideration and enabled the Government to table its concession ndash branded a U-turn by Labour ndash following a fierce public backlash.The new Government proposal would put a legal duty on utility firms to ldquosecure a progressive reduction in the adverse impacts of discharges from storm overflows.Mr Eustice told GT on Times Radio on Sunday: ldquoIt does everything the Duke of Wellingtonrsquos amendment did, and so he recognised that this is a challenge that you wouldnrsquot solve overnight because the cost of removing all of these storm overflows could be up to pound billion.ldquoBut thatrsquos not to say we shouldnrsquot signicantly reduce their use, and since the s most housesrsquo surface water drainage has been on a dferent drainage system to the foul water sewage system, but often theyrsquove ended up being pumped back into the sewer further down the line..removeldquoIt may be therersquos some interventions that can be made that make a big dference even though they wouldnrsquot necessarily move all of these CSOsovernight.ldquoSo the Duke of Wellington recognised you wouldnrsquot do this overnight, thatrsquos why his emphasis was on making a signicant reduction in the use of these CSOs, and that is what wersquore going to be mirroring in the amendment wersquove tabled.YOU HAVE JUST  HOURS TO SAVE YOUR LOCAL RIVER.Tomorrow Gov will vote to legalise the wholesale dumping of sewage into our rives.Just as MPs were mislead over the cost of fixing sewage overflows, #SewageScandal environment groups have now also been mislead.mdash Feargal SharkeyNovember , But Jo Maugham, director of the Good Law Project, called the amendment a ldquopolitical ruse.He wrote on Twitter: ldquoThe duty is to lsquoachieve a progressive reductionrsquo. But the duty is meaningless.ldquoIf I was a water company and every year I reduced the amount of sewage I dumped by  ,th I would be making a lsquoprogressive reductionrsquo but I could carry on dumping shit for , years.A total of  Conservative MPs rebelled last month to support the Duke of Wellingtonrsquos initial proposal, with one of this group telling the PA news agency they are happy with the new Government amendment.But Green Party peer Baroness Jones of Moulsecoomb said the Government concession was ldquonot good enough as it failed to stipulate measurements or metrics for the reduction required by water companies.She told PA: ldquoThe Government is running scared of the water companies and their owners when what they should be doing is thinking about the health of people and the environment.Lady Jones added: ldquoItrsquos a typical Government fudge to make their MPs think theyrsquore doing the right thing.The Bill as a whole seeks to write environmental principles into UK law for the first time, following Brexit.It is currently in the parliamentary stage known as ldquoping-pong, where a piece of legislation moves between the Commons and Lords until agreement can be reached..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Environment Secretary claims sewage dumping concession  umirrors u peers u demands article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentComments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi stock gin advent calendar
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAdvent calendars are a great way to count down to Christmas. A chocolate reward each day of the festive period  Yes please.Nowadays advent calendars stock just about anything. From beauty products to alcohol, all gting you a little surprise on the lead up to Christmas Day." alt"Penarth Times:  days of gin bottles " class"editor-image" days of gin bottles And Aldi is no exception to the fun advent calendars, recently announcing a wine advent calendar and a sparkling wine one also.The supermarket has now added to its roster of alcohol advent calendars, announcing a Haysmith Gin advent calendar, online now!The deal is an online exclusive, so you wont find it in stores.Many advent calendars with higher priced items in them tend to only gt you for  days of the month to remain affordable, but not this one you will be gted with a cl bottle every day until Christmas Eve." alt"Penarth Times: Haysmith Gin Advent Calendar " class"editor-image"Haysmith Gin Advent Calendar The calendar costs just pound. for the  miniatures of Haysmith Gin and includes a mix of  flavours such as:bull London Dry Ginbull Rhubarb  Ginger Ginbull Sloe Ginbull Seville Orange  Persian Lime Ginbull Raspberry  Redcurrant Pink Ginbull Spiced Plum  Clementine GinYou can pick up this and other beverage advent calendars on the Aldi website now. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi donating food charities christmas   get involved
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFood that does not sell in stores will be donated to local charities rather than go to waste.As part of Aldirsquos pledge to donate  million meals this year to families across the UK facing hunger, the supermarket has committed to donate more meals over the festive period.Christmas is a great time for organisations to benefit from Aldirsquos partnership with Neighbourly, a community engagement  that links businesses to food banks and charities.This enables Aldirsquos UK stores to donate surplus food seven days a week, all year round.Aldi stores will be closed on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Years DayWith all Aldi stores set to close on Christmas Day, Boxing Day and NewYearrsquos Day, the retailer wants to ensure that any products approaching the end of their shelf-le reach wont be wasted and can be given to families who might otherwise miss out this Christmas.Charities, food banks and community groups who could benefit from the scheme are encouraged to get in touch and register now for a festive food donation from the supermarket.Existing charity partnerships will be prioritised for these festive collections, but where therersquos availability, additional organisations are being invited to apply to be paired with a local Aldi store to collect fresh and chilled food products ndash including fruit, vegetables, fresh meat, fish and bread ndash ahead of stores closing on both Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve.Did you know you can get your remembrance poppy in your local Aldi Heres a few of the things were doing to remember our fallen heroes.## #ArmisticeDay #RemembranceSunday pic wsbUgZsKHmdash Aldi Stores UKNovember , Mary Dunn, Managing Director of Corporate Responsibility at Aldi UK, said: ldquoOur food donations scheme operates year-round, but we know that Christmas can be a particularly dficult time for the families and communities we support..removeldquoThatrsquos why we are so committed to increasing the number of meals we donate over the festive season, and we look forward to working with local charities this Christmas to help us meet our  million meals target for the year.Steve Butterworth, from Neighbourly, added: ldquoWith the impact of the pandemic still being felt by communities up and down the country, charities and local causes are eaxpecting record demand for their services this Christmas.ldquoWersquore sure there are lots more groups out there that could put this food to good use, so wersquod encourage them to get in touch.Organisations do not need to be a registered charity to apply but must:Have a level two hygiene certicate gained in the last two yearsBe able to transport and store chilled food products after collecting them on Christmas Eve and New Yearrsquos Eve at pmThose interested in working with Aldi this Christmas should contact Neighbourly at aldichristmas@neighbourly before th December .Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: celebrity  itv start date confirmed
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAccording to TV sources, ITV are planning on starting the new series hosted by Ant and Dec on Sunday, November .This years show will once again be filmed from the historic Gwrych Castle, Abergele in North Wales.The much-loved series - fronted by the nations favourite duo Ant  Dec - will see a celebrity crowned the king or queen of the castle once again as travel restriction remain in place amid the coronavirus pandemic.The listed building was revamped in order to house celebrities for weeks on end and is reported to have cost in excess of poundmillion to hire for six weeks last year.The first queen of the castle was Giovanna Fletcher who won last yearrsquos show with former Eastenders star being the last winner in Australia when she won the year before.Eastenders star set to appear in the new seriesAnother Albert Square resident is rumoured to be taking part in this yearrsquos series with Adam Woodyatt reportedly signed up for the upcoming st series." alt"Penarth Times: Ant and Dec willto film the st series of Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here. " class"editor-image"Ant and Dec willto film the st series of Im A Celebrity...Get Me Out Of Here. Woodyatt, famous for his portrayal of Albert Square legend Ian Beale, has been absent from the BBC soap since earlier this year.According to reports, the -year-old has signed a huge deal to feature on the latest series of the ITV hit.ITV bossesare said to be ldquovery excited to have signed the soap legend up for this yearrsquos series." alt"Penarth Times: Woodyatt, famous for his portrayal of Albert Square legend Ian Beale is rumoured to be taking part in the new series. " class"editor-image"Woodyatt, famous for his portrayal of Albert Square legend Ian Beale is rumoured to be taking part in the new series. Good Morning BritainpresenterRichard Madeleyhas reportedly signed a pound, deal to take on the showrsquos infamous Bushtucker Trials.FormerCoronation StreetstarLucy Fallon, known for playing Bethany Platt in the ITV soap is another rumoured contestant as speculation continues.Frankie Bridge, , whorsquos former footballer husband Wayne, took part in the show has also been rumoured.Coronation Streetrsquos Simon Gregson, who plays Steve McDonald, is the latest celebrity rumoured to be taking part as well as Strictly Come Dancing judge Arlene Phillips..removeAn ITV spokesperson said: ldquoAny names suggested for the new series of Irsquom A CelebrityhellipGet Me Out Of Here! are just speculation. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments: Our rulesWe want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. title: aldi offering courses help babies sleep
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia, will start making infant sleeping courses affordable for all UK families.Part of its Specialbuy range, in partnership with Just Chill Baby Sleep, Aldi will help to establish healthy sleep routines for parents and their children.Online courses will start from as little as pound. This is a % discount on standard rates across all sleep courses.Parents can choose from four informative courses that cater for new-borns to four-year-olds:Foundations of Sleep: - months.Practical advice on how to navigate the first few months with a new baby, helping to lay solid sleep foundations and understand their sleep habits: pound. .Sleep Success: - months.Help with nap and bedtime challenge and understanding your babyrsquos sleep needs to help them sleep peacefully and achieve a better sleep quality: pound .Sleep Success: - months.Advice on how to successfully navigate nap times, bedtime and approach nighttime wakingrsquos for a better quality sleep: pound .Sleep Success:  months to  years.Understand a childrsquos sleep needs, including when and how to successfully transition them from a cot to a bed, allowing them to sleep happily in their own space: pound .Rosey Davidson, Infant Sleep Consultant and Founder of Just Chill Baby Sleep, says: ldquoIrsquom so excited that Just Chill Baby Sleep is partnering with Aldirsquos baby and toddler brand, Mamia."For so many parents the cost of in-person sleep support is out of reach, which is why we created our online courses and why this partnership means so much."To be able to offer our courses at a massive % discount and reach even more parents in need is fantastic, and wersquore looking forward to helping new parents and their little ones get the best night sleep possible..remove" alt"Penarth Times: Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound " class"editor-image"Aldi is offering courses on how to get your baby to sleep for under pound Here to offer some advice, Rosey has put together a parental checklist for bedtime which she has shared exclusively with Mamia, to give parents a helping hand at what can be the most dficult time of the day:Have a regular, predictable routineHaving a good balance of sleep in the day can really help your baby to sleep well at night. While all babies are dferent, it can be helpful to think about working towards a routine by doing the same things in the same order each night so that baby learns what is coming next.Think about your little onersquos sleep environmentIt can be helpful to black out bedrooms, something that can be especially important in the summer months. Temperature is also important the Lullaby Trust, the baby sleep charity, say that the safest temperature for our little ones is - degrees celsius.Looking at how your little one falls asleep can help them get a more settled nightIt is very normal for your little one to be fed, rocked or cuddled to sleep, however this can be dficult to maintain. Practice other ways of getting your baby to sleep in their own sleep space to help find a method that suits you, your baby and your parenting style.Watch out for signs of tirednessWhile there are typical s of time that babies will happily stay awake for, the most important thing is getting to know your baby. By observing your baby, you can try to get them down for naps during the day before they get overtired. It is also important not to try to force naps when they are under tired.Fresh air and exerciseGetting out of the house for a bit will blow the cobwebs away and help your little one to burn off some energy. Inside the home your little one will also benefit from lots of time on the floor to keep them moving, while for small babies practising a bit of tummy time can be really helpful.Donrsquot always rush inhellipSometimes your little one will babble or make noise while they are asleep, and by going in too quickly we can disturb them. Equally they can sometimes wake and be happy in their sleep space. If your little one doesnrsquot need your assistance it is important to give them the space to get themselves back to sleep independently.Take care of yourself and donrsquot be afraid to ask for helpTherersquos no shame in not being able to do it all, all of the time. Being sleep deprived can be incredibly challenging and feel very lonely. Please know that is very normal for sleep to be dficult, especially in those early days. Please remember being a parent doesnrsquot always feel easy, because itrsquos not! You are doing a great job.To book a course or find out more, visit the Aldi website.Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: aldi release christmas advert teaser social media
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFrom the teaser Aldi have released on social mediait seems as though Kevin has been replaced by a banana named Ebanana Scrooge.Not the kids as well!!!! #NoShame #JusticeKevin pic uMnPNkljmdash Aldi Stores UKNovember , The  second teaser reveals child Ebanana waiting patiently on Christmas eve, hoping to finally meet Santa Claus.Ebanana is on a plate,snuggled up next to a mince pie in front of a warming log fire. Suddenly, a mystery hand appearsand takes away the mince pie, leaving poor Ebanana behind.Watch the Aldi Christmas advert teaser hereAs the banana watches the mince pie being taken it cries, ldquoSanta, waithellip why didnrsquot he take me Quickly Ebananarsquos confusion turns into anger, jumping up and yelling, ldquoI hate ChristmashellipThe clip fades, and the teaser leaves viewers on tenterhooks as to what will happen next in this festive tale.The full Aldi advert will premier online and on national TV on Thursday, November , so we still have some time before we find out how this story ends.Where is Kevin the Carrot Sorry everyone. Due to ongoing proceedings, #KevinTheCarrot might have to miss Christmas this year. #JusticeKevin #mdash Aldi Stores UKNovember , The last five Christmas adverts have featured the lovable Kevin the Carrot, who wersquove seen on Santarsquos sleigh, fall in love, and battle the wicked parsnip.On the Kevin section of the Aldi website, the supermarket confirm his departure.It said: "We know yoursquore excited about getting a first look at Kevin for  but wersquove not seen him or his family since Christmas ."If he gets in touch, wersquoll let you know. Until then,wersquove put together Kevinrsquos best bits over the years. So many great adventures.".removeYou can see all of Kevins best bits on the Aldi website.Aldi have taken to Twitter, acussing competing supermarkets of brutally selling Kevin as a vegetable.This year Ebanana Scrooge takes his place. Will the bananarsquos story capture us the same way Aldirsquos full Christmas advert airs on November .Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice.
